results.description:
Join 50 to 80 or 100 dancers any Wednesday at Dance Freedom!!

We are the original barefoot weekly dance, continuously running for 44 years, that has spawned hundreds if not thousands of other dances around the world.

In a drug, alcohol, and shoe-free environment, we've been making friends and sharing safe and juicy dances for decades. Come join the fun!! Discover the joy of dancing in a totally non-judgmental atmosphere, where anything safe and respectful goes... dance by yourself, in a group, with a same or opposite sex partner, or even just chat and enjoy watching.

First time visitors are welcomed heartily, and get in for half price! Otherwise, you decide what to pay in a range from $10 to $20, or less later in the evening as the event nears its end (information on late admission discounts is at the door). Our friendly dancers range from utterly new at it to very skilled dancers in funk, rock, salsa, modern, jazz, hip-hop, African & Latin and swing, tango, contact improvisation, and our own unique spontaneous creations! Dance with or alongside amazing dancers from local dance troupes as well as with ordinary good-hearted rug cutters. At work they may be doctors, lawyers, programmers, massage therapists, expressive therapists, artists, students, dog walkers, scientists, or anything else, but at heart they all love to dance.

The music runs the gamut: funk, world music, soul & r&b, house, trance, hip-hop, salsa, yoga music, jazz or swing, reggae, disco, you name it! Each DJ from our rotating list has a unique style, but we try to include something for everyone in every set. We keep a good balance in the music: familiar with unusual, timeless with current, melodic with drum-based, and positive lyrics with instrumentals--in all kinds of rhythms & styles! In any given evening, the world music parts of our dance are likely to include at least 3 or so of the following... African, Latin, Indian, Middle Eastern, Caribbean, zydeco, gypsy and much more. You'll hear everything from basic party music to very danceable songs with socially conscious lyrics, but you won't be hearing anything sexist, racist, violent, hating or otherwise divisive.

Start with a soothing stretch and warm up at 7:30, connect with the group and start to boogie at 7:50 with our first DJ of the evening, take a brief break at 8:50 for community announcements and a short unique performance or workshop (or chatting & stretching in a way that doesn't interfere), then cut the rug again by 9:15 at the latest with the evening's second DJ, till 10:30--plenty of time for a great workout and some feel-good inspiration and respiration and perspiration!

At the beginning of each half of the evening's music, everyone who wants to gathers around a centerpiece to hold hands, and dance in a winding chain together to a song with uplifting, connective (or at least beautiful and hypnotic) slow to medium tempo rhythms. (This dance was created from out of a drumming circle on the Cambridge Common in the sixties, after all, and some of that great political and community spirit still lives on here.) Then, it's all dance music, generally building in tempo to a crescendo, slowing down again for some more melodic and slow dance songs for a few minutes, then gradually building to a second crescendo. The second half of the evening's dance follows roughly the same pattern with a different DJ and style, and ends with another circle dance for those who enjoy it.

Dancers are always welcome to help with set-up or take-down, and get in free for doing so! It's a great chance to get to know the community better and be serviceful, as well as to save money and help us to be around for another 42 years... Welcome! For more information, E-mail: [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: Opposite the Cambridge Common, see the Sheraton Hotel w/the big red letters COMMANDER on top.  Enter the stone church just left of hotel, @ entrance closest to hotel.  Follow the hall straight, left and right to the desk to sign in.

results.description:
** Walk down the driveway to the rear of the building; we have a
private entrance at ground level. **
Come and join us for an evening of fun and shared energy. How
often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in
Boston?
At TurnON, we play three communication games, and you can
participate at whatever level feels good to you. Imagine meeting
new people in an environment where they feel comfortable to be
themselves; a refreshing change from the typical networking or
bar conversation. That's what we have created.
TurnON events give you the opportunity to look deeper into
yourself, through other people putting quality attention on you,
asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses. What comes up might surprise you!
It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a
room full of strangers - when we are willing to be authentic. It's
like a giant exhale when the rest of the world is asking you to
hold it in. In just an hour, you may even forget that you are in
Boston.
TurnON Boston is an organization that teaches Orgasmic
Meditation, otherwise known as OM. At the end of the evening,
we will give you a brief description of the practice of Orgasmic
Meditation and information on where to learn more. The games
we play at TurnON events are designed to create the visceral
sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without actually doing the
practice (or touching anyone, or removing any clothing!).
** We start on time, so please arrive by 7:20.**
$10, payable at the door.
results.name: TurnON Boston!

Come and join us for an evening of fun and shared energy. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in Boston?

At TurnON, we play three communication games, and you can participate at whatever level feels good to you. Imagine meeting new people in an environment where they feel comfortable to be themselves; a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation. That's what we have created.


TurnON events give you the opportunity to look deeper into yourself, through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses. What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to be authentic. It's like a giant exhale when the rest of the world is asking you to hold it in. In just an hour, you may even forget that you are in Boston.

TurnON Boston is an organization that teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. At the end of the evening, we will give you a brief description of the practice of Orgasmic Meditation and information on where to learn more. The games we play at TurnON events are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without actually doing the practice (or touching anyone, or removing any clothing!).

** We start on time, so please arrive by 7:20.**

$10, payable at the door.
results.how_to_find_us: Walk down the driveway to the rear of the building; we have a private entrance at ground level.
results.name: TurnON Boston!

results.description:
RoLa Languages Institute is planning to have a great time with all those who have an interest in speaking English. There will be many English learners and a teacher to help so you can practice your English, learn from fellow students and teachers as well as <a>make friends</a>!

For whom?

Everyone who has any interest in English, from beginner students to native speakers.


When?

Wednesday, August 5th from 7:30 pm - 10:00 pm


Where?

Pho House, 1790 Massachusetts Avenue (above RoLa's Porter Square office in Cambridge)


What will we do?

We will speak English and have some drinks and food!


Come and join our party! We don't care about who you are, where you're from or how you look! Just come and practice your English! This is a really great chance to improve your English skills! 

It's a free, public event but food and drink purchases are a courteous gesture to the restaurant that hosts us, not to mention delicious! 

If you need more information, please contact us!

Website: www.rolalang.com

Email: [masked]

Telephone: (617) 297 - 7789

We hope to see you on Wednesday, August 4th!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the RoLa Languages sign!
results.name: Speak & Practice English

results.description:
The Public Open Night at the Observatory is a chance for people to come observe the night sky through telescopes and binoculars and see things they otherwise might not get to see, and learn some astronomy as well. The Open Nights are held most Wednesday evenings throughout the year, weather permitting.

It is open to everyone. Starting times are 7:30pm during the fall and winter, and 8:30pm during the spring and summer. The program lasts about an hour.

Weather

The weather is always a factor when observing. Unfortunately we can’t control the weather and we can’t observe when there are clouds, haze, or rain; so when the weather is bad, the Open Night will be canceled. Predicting the weather in New England isn’t easy, so we won’t know if the Open Night will be held or not until the day of the program. To find out if the Open Night will be held, call our information number at[masked], no earlier than two hours before the scheduled starting time. This lets us make the decision as late as possible while still giving those who live farther away time to get here.

Remember, it gets very cold in Boston in the winter and the telescopes are outside, so dress warmly.

>>> Tickets <<<

Public Open Nights are open to everyone, however space is limited. To reserve a ticket for admission click this link which will take you to our Eventbrite page.  [see website]

Location

The Public Open Night is held at the Coit Observatory at Boston University. We are located at 725 Commonwealth Ave. in Boston, right above the Astronomy Department. The stairwell to the Observatory is on the fifth floor right next to room 520.

Unfortunately, there is no disabled access to the Observatory.
Information

For information, please call[masked]-2630.

The Public Open Night at the Observatory is held clear Wednesday nights from 8:30 – 9:30pm. Call[masked] for the status.

Source: http://www.bu.edu/astronomy/events/public-open-night-at-the-observatory/
results.name: Public Open Night - Coit Observatory at Boston University

We are returning back to Source ~ to who we truly are! 

Sacred Sound Soul Tone can assist you on your journey!

**Soul Tone is multi-dimensional energy & sound healing**

We ALL channel Source - yes all of us can and do!

As part of her life and soul's purpose, Nicol brings to you Source in the form of sound, energy and light language. Nicol is simply a guide and mirror to your true 'self' - the Source within You! 

'I am simply a guide on a jounrey to meet your highest self (source) in a 'space' that allows for deep healing and alignment of your truth.  Helping you Remember who you truely are and why you are here now! Nicol

Soul Tone  is a combination of guided meditation, sound, and light language offered in individual and group sessions to assit you in aligning to and integrating with Your Life / Soul's Plan.

Powerful LIVE Soul Tone Groups

• Deepen your awareness & heighten your consciousness. 

• Increase healing energy and Source to flow through you.

• Awaken and bring forth your innate healing gifts and tools.

• Awaken your DNA & soul's blueprint according to your life/soul plan

• Confirm that you are not alone and you are not going 'crazy'! 

• Energetically supports you on your journey - regardless of where you are at!

• Supports you in living a more peaceful and joyous life - on your terms!

Experience a powerful and healing Soul Tone  group and

Experience Source:Experience You!

$10 each group

Meeting each Wednesday in August - days will change in September!

What to experience in a group...

Nicol will lead the group through breathing and relaxing into a deeping state of awareness.  Source will come through the words, sounds and tones as the group receives healing.  Light language will support the process as keys, codes and frequencies of light are channeled in to support the individual as well as group.  As guided by Source, Nicol will personally connect with each participant and share a unique individual Soul Tone to help you clear, align and receive the gifts of your own Soul - Resonating with your Soul and Remembering who you are!

Many feel the energies 'highten' as we allow our selves to dissolve into the multidimensional aspects of self - of Source - connecting to us to the onesness and allness that we are - to the multidimensional beings that we are.  Many share the experiences of...lightness, stillness, peace, releasing, tingling, answers to questions and healing of unresolved issues.  And others simply enjoy the quiet time of relaxation and experience nothing more than that! 

Nicol is the co-creator of Soul Tone...

In co-creation with Source, Nicol is the only one doing this specific work at this time!  And it is profoundly evolving at a rapid rate! 

Yes, others may be doing similar type groups, workshops and sessions...and yes we are all working with Source, Spirit, Universal Energy or even God some may call it!  It is Nicol's innate gift to share with you on your path!

Nicol has been in this field for over 15 years and has completely opened and surrendered to her Life/Soul's Plan and in that surrendering has received this gift to share with you! 

And more about all this and more at Essence of Healing here!

results.description:
Here's the game plan:

8:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

8:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

8:20 - Play!!!!!!

10:00 - Conclude the meetup and begin socializing


Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white and a dark-colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a dark or white "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!

results.description:
https://plus.google.com/events/c0oegddjuh07utbrq1mv6vm1rfg

Ellen Jaffe JonesThe Veg Coach

Creative Cook / Author / Consultant 
From our test kitchen to your home kitchen 

OK, show of hands.  How many of you eat quinoa as a side dish? 
Most cooks use the protein-rich grain as a substitute for rice. 
But, I've got a treat for you today.  It's a recipe for Quinoa crisp chocolate balls! 
What a way to reward yourself for following a healthy lifestyle. 

Find it below.

Consider this too as a tasty approach to getting people interested in coming to one of my FREE cooking classes. This week, Wednesday at 9pm EST, I'll be doing a free class prepping and serving 2 recipes from my book "Eat Vegan on $4 a Day." Bring any questions to our Google Hangout: 

https://plus.google.com/events/c0oegddjuh07utbrq1mv6vm1rfg

Happy cooking,

Ellen Jaffe Jones 
The Veg Coach 
http://www.vegcoach.com

Buy my books:

Paleo Vegan

Eat Vegan on $4 a Day

Kitchen Divided - Vegan Recipes for Semi-Vegan Households

This is a Quinoa crisp chocolate bar you might find at your local health food store.  
But, my recipe lets you create your own Quinoa chocolate treat.  

It'll satisfy your chocolate cravings and it's so easy to make.  

The recipe is below. 

You're Going to Love This!  

Quinoa Crisp Chocolate Treats 
by Ellen Jaffe Jones 

INGREDIENTS 

1 cup vegan chocolate chips 
1/2 cup puffed quinoa 
4 teaspoons coconut oil 
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional) 

PREPARATION INSTRUCTIONS 

1 cup vegan chocolate chips 
1/2 cup puffed quinoa 
4 teaspoons coconut oil 
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional) 

Melt chocolate chips in a double-boiler, or place in a microwave-safe bowl and heat for about 60 seconds until the chips develop a slight sheen. 
Place all ingredients in a medium pot (or add to the double-boiler) and over medium heat, and stir constantly for about 5 minutes taking care not to burn the chocolate. 
Form small balls and place on a non-stick cookie sheet. 
Refrigerate for at least 60 minutes before serving. 
For those wanting to reduce fat intake, this can be made without the coconut oil, but make sure the chocolate chips are completely melted.

results.description:
Tune in at http://artistfirst.com/arthurdschwartz.htm


The Orphan Conspiracies by James Morcan and  Lance Morcan is a non-fictional spinoff of the three novels that comprise the Morcans' popular collection, The Orphan Trilogy. Tonight's guest will be James Morcan, and we will discuss some the the 29 conspiracies covered in the non-fictional The Orphan Conspiracies, as well as other aspects of James' extremely interesting career. James is an actor/writer/producer and--accordingly--much of his work is expressed in both books and film.

From Amazon.com:

Garnering evidence from court cases, declassified government files and mainstream media reports, the authors disclose little-known facts on a wide range of topics. Diverse subjects such as mind control, eugenics, false flag operations, The Queen's hidden assets, secret prisons, The Catcher in the Rye enigma, political assassinations, medical cover-ups, genius learning techniques, Yamashita's Gold, the Jonestown mystery, Americanized Nazis, the bankrupting of Third World nations, underground bases, the US Federal Reserve, the New World Order, forbidden science, the War on Drugs, subliminal messages and even extraterrestrials….

Written from multiple perspectives; at times giving voice to conspiracy theorists; on other occasions siding with sceptics; vacillating between serious investigative writing and tongue-in-cheek, self-deprecating humor - The Orphan Conspiracies delivers a balanced exposé of some of the most important issues of our time.


In their unflinching quest for truth and justice, the Morcans take no prisoners as they 'subpoena' the global elite - be they banksters, US Presidents, British Royals, Big Pharma, the Vatican, the FBI, the CIA, the Military Industrial Complex or the founders and CEO's of multinational corporations like Facebook, Shell, Google, BP and Microsoft. No suspicious individual or organization is granted immunity in this no-holds-barred trial conducted on behalf of The People... 


"I expect readers of this book will be surprised by the level of knowledge imparted in its pages, especially with its revelations of exotic technologies, financial injustices, political deceptions and suppressed scientific discoveries. I also expect readers will be inspired by the lifting of the veil that occurs when long-guarded information is absorbed."  -- Dr. Takaaki Musha, from the Foreword to The Orphan Conspiracies  (read  the complete text on Amazon)

New Zealand-born James Morcan resides in Sydney, Australia. His other books--all co-authored with his father Lance--in addition to the three-volume The Orphan Trilogy, include  the historical adventure series The World Duology  (World Odyssey / Fiji: A Novel) and the controversial non-fiction Underground Knowledge Series (Genius Intelligence / Antigravity Propulsion etc). James also has a very active film career; his feature films have screened at cinemas in New Zealand, India, Australia, Italy and Cannes. Visit his Amazon Author Page for more details.


Also visit Lance and James' website at  http://morcanbooksandfilms.com/</a>

Join us again this Thursday morning (8/6) before you head out to work for a guided meditation of Scripture in the Jesuit tradition of Lectio Divina (Sacred Reading). All faiths (or non-faiths) are welcome! Alice will be facilitating.


What is Lectio?

Lectio Divina is an ancient Christian practice of unhurried, contemplative meditation on a portion of Scripture following four basic movements: 

Lectio: a time of slow repeated reading of Scripture punctuated by the use of a bell or chime. 

Meditatio: A time of quiet reflection on God's words and presence. 

Oratio: A time of silent conversational intimacy with God. 

Contemplatio: A time of listening for God's words for us personally.

We hope you'll join us in this deeply enriching spiritual practice.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be sitting on a sheet in the grass across from Stony Brook station.
results.name: Lectio Divina Meditation (Sacred Reading)

results.description:
The Golden Chickpea in Brookline Village is hosting a breakfast on Thursdays for Moms and babies/toddlers. The little ones can play while we chat- there are plenty of toys. Hope to see some of you there!

http://www.thegoldenchickpeacenter.com

At The Golden Chickpea Center, we provide a warm and friendly atmosphere with emotional and social support in Brookline Village. Our main objective is to strengthen the initial emotional bond between families and their children in the community, particularly those who have no other family in the area.

In a cosmopolitan city such as Boston where young families come from many parts of the country and the world, due to education and professional opportunities, being far away from family is a common occurrence. Our center is a great alternative to fill this need.

We aim to be the premiere urban destination for cosmopolitan families with young children to socialize, have fun, and experience the richness of different cultures among us.

 Our Center is a welcoming place for families of all compositions and backgrounds where children and parents can learn, play and grow together creating shared experiences that last a lifetime... 


If you are one of those  families, join us,  you will feel at home!
results.name: Breakfast at The Golden Chickpea Center

results.description:
Come join me for a four-day cruise up North. AZZURRA is a 30' cruiser/racer with accommodations for four adults. The cruise will be great fun with lots of sailing, time for swimming and fishing, and plenty of socializing! THE FINAL NIGHT OF THIS CRUISE WILL BE GREAT MISERY ISLAND TO JOIN THE FLOTILLA!

The boat has a galley with ice-box and two-burner stove, working marine head, charcoal grill, dinghy with oars, and fishing rods. All of the required safety gear is onboard as well as plenty of GPS and Charts....cell-phones and tablets can be charged while the engine is running.

The Itinerary is:

Day 1 (Thursday) - Boston to Gloucester or Rockport

Day 2 (Friday) - Gloucester or Rockport to Isle of Shoals, NH

Day 3 (Saturday) - Isle of Shoals to Great Misery Island (a great little island in Salem Sound with a cove for anchoring)

Day 4 (Sunday) Isle of Shoals to Boston

Beginners with an interest in developing their sailing skills are welcome.

I am not allowing RSVP's with a guest because of space for Crewseekers members. If you would like to bring a guest please email me and we will see what works out. of course, your guest could simply sign-up for crewfinders and rsvp...a hint.

There is information about me on my Crewseekers profile.

There is no charge for this trip but we will plan a menu together and all will chip in for the groceries. I will set up a google group to facilitate the meal planning, and I will also do the shopping and get the food onto the boat.

Let's go sailing, ya'll.
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet at Starbucks for coffee and introductions. Then walk 3 minutes to the launch.
results.name: Four Day Cruise on AZZURRA with Greg Allen...Thursday 8/6 - Sunday 8/9

Meditation practice develops concentration, which allows us to calm and steady the mind and give us clear access to our natural wisdom. This practice is 30 minutes of guided Vipassana meditation followed by a brief discussion.

The focus is to be present in the moment, allowing thoughts and emotions to surface. We become an internal observer of these, fostering healthy non-attachment and cultivating a deeper connection with one's inner self.

Newcomers to meditation and long-time practitioners are welcome to attend.

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

Endless Summer at Legal Sea Foods’ Charles Square Terrace Bar
Invites everyone who can’t stand the heat, to get out of the kitchen

After the longest, coldest, harshest winter in history, this will be the best summer ever. And Legal Sea Foods is throwing its chef hat in the ring to make it one, by offering special summer eats at its Terrace Bar in Cambridge.

The party starts in June and lasts through August, and each month will be celebrated with a special menu feature, exclusive to the huge outdoor bar in front of the Charles Hotel.

August: Souped Up Gazpacho Bar
one cup $6 / gazpachio trio $15

Red: tomato w/ veggies and tortilla strips
Green: cucumber, greek yogurt, avocado
Yellow: cantaloupe, crème fraiche, EVOO
White: almonds, sherry vinegar, grapes
Gazpacho Trio: $15.00

Toppings - A La Carte $3

Sweet Maine Crab Meat
Pickled Texas Shrimp
Squid Escabeche
Saffron Poached Mussels
Cajun Flaked Salmon
Pickled Papaya
Mango Salsa

Because: Cold soup on a hot day works, and seafood on top makes it even cooler.

results.description:
Interested in developing cross platform mobile apps? Have you thought about how to connect your apps in the back end? Azure Mobile Services is a quick and easy way to provide data storage (accessible through REST API calls), Push Notifications, and authentication with Microsoft Accounts. All of this functionality works on each of the top Mobile Platforms!. We will take a look at the Azure portal as well as the tooling built into Visual Studio giving you, the developer, a couple of different options for setting up your backend and quickly putting you on your way to making your first cross platform mobile app! Bio:

Gavin Bauman graduated from Xavier University of Louisiana with a major in Computer Science (Class of 2014). Immediately upon graduation, he joined Microsoft as a Technical Evangelist in Boston. He has spoken at numerous local events, like the Boston Code Camp and PAX East, and has also spoken at numerous schools delivering technical workshops and professional development sessions. When he’s not punishing his foes in Mortal Kombat, he’s spending his time getting involved in mobile app development.
results.name: Gavin Bauman: Intro to Azure Mobile Services

results.description:
Take The  8 Steps That Will Change Your Life

The Original Steppers of Boston has earned two  Steppin' Instruction Certifications**.                            


Every Thursday

Classes - Practice - Open Dance

Beginners Welcome!!
Men, Women, Singles, Couples

 

Instructional Hours:

 

Beginners Class 6pm -7pm

Everyone Else Class 7pm-8pm


Open Dance & Practice 8pm - Until


 

The Original Steppers of Boston offer Certified Chicago Style Steppin' dance instruction for the new beginner to the seasoned stepper. We also host a supportive environment for steppers to practice and participate in an open dance to hone their dance skills.

We welcome you to stop by to get an idea of what Steppin' Chicago Style is all about. There is a $10 participation fee to get on the dance floor, first visit is FREE. A partner is encouraged, but not required.

Doors open at 6:00pm.

*** Please wear comfortable clothes and smooth bottom shoes (NO SNEAKERS, MARKING SOLES or RUBBER BOTTOMS)!  Gentlemen must remove their hats. Powder is not allowed on the dance floor***

Bring your Steppin' notebook
Courtesy Note:: Please be on time.
Practice outside of class is expected and necessary.

Class attendance may be a prerequisite for the Royce Banks Steppin' Is A Lifestyle Workshops.

**Certified Instruction provided by The Original Steppers of Boston Inc 2006 Team**

Full Bar!!  Free Parking!! Kitchen is Open!!

We ask that you patronize the bar and tip the staff for their services.

 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lzQYE4HRygM

results.description:
NEXT LEVEL BUSINESS FORUM is an institution dedicated to helping businesses and their managers get to their “next level.”


THIS WEEK Gain Street will help you get matched with a Coach. We'll be focusing on Business Coaching, as a solution to the small business dilemma.

See more details in the agenda below.

--

GETTING HERE

Join us at MIT's Cambridge Innovation Center, 1 Broadway, Cambridge, 5th floor, Cozumel Room

• Register as a guest at the front desk and mention that you're attending our event on the 5th floor.

• Optionally: Meet us at Venture Cafe for networking before the event. Venture Cafe serves as a physical nexus for helping innovators and entrepreneurs find one another and collaborate to bring their dreams to reality.  All attendees to the Cafe should adhere to the Venture Cafe contributor model (http://vencaf.org/thursdaycafeboston/contributor-model/) and credo (http://vencaf.org/credo/). Learn more here: vencaf.org.

--


QUESTIONS? NEED HELP?

- Contact Ian: [masked], call or text: (802)[masked]

- Look for the Gain Street sign or anyone wearing a green Gain Street T-shirt in the Venture Cafe before our event

--

AGENDA

5 pm - Optional networking at Venture Cafe

*Venture Cafe is a members-only club for innovators. Learn more here: vencaf.org


6 pm - FREE PIZZA - Gain Street's Next Level Business Forum

Follow signs to the Cozumel Room on the 5th floor.

Need help getting here? Contact [masked], call or text: (802)[masked]


1. Intros

2. Guided Discussion by our Expert panel of business coaches focusing on the problems of small businesses and importance of coaching

3. Get matched to a business coach, and get FREE advice on your business dilemmas

--


REQUESTS & FEEDBACK - [masked]


Let us know what you want most from this group! We’d love to hear your ideas about how we can use our resources to help businesses get to the next level.

--


GAIN STREET


Have you heard about Gain Street??


...Gain Street is the best place to get help for your business.


We're a funded startup at MIT's Cambridge Innovation Center, and we're building an app that's also a "business coach"


Leveling up your “Gain Street Cred” improves your business in real life.


On Gain Street you can

- See how you stack up against other businesses like you

- Get help from coaches and experts where you need it most

- And discover opportunities to take your business to the next level


Learn more about us at www.GainStreet.co
results.how_to_find_us: Contact Ian: call or text: (802) 399-9921

Harborwalk Sounds Free Summer Concerts Presents: Beneil and His Reggae Orchestra.

Hey let's go listen to some free live music as the sun sets over the water! We will get to visit the museum afterwards and if people are up for it we can go grab a bite to eat and something to drink not to far from the ICA. I will have a Meetup sign. We will meet at the tables which are past the bleachers near the band.

Harborwalk Sounds Free Summer Concerts Presents: Wavelength Sounds Beneil and His Reggae Orchestra

Hey let's go listen to some free live music as the sun sets over the water! We will get to visit the museum afterwards and if people are up for it we can go grab a bite to eat and something to drink not to far from the ICA.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZIc-zzW7aQo

Beneil Miller is a young, vibrant musician from the beautiful Cayman Islands. Although he came to Boston to study jazz piano, throughout his college journey he also became a songwriter and vocalist. He has received the Young Musician of the Year Award from the Cayman Islands Music and Entertainment Association and played keyboards for Caribbean artists such as Jabez and Romain Virgo. In 2014 Miller's debut reggae album, Keyz to My Heart, was born. With a blend of roots reggae, jazz, R&B, and many more genres, he was able to create the perfect stew of what he envisioned for reggae music.

Convey will no longer be playing but feel free to still come out to this.

Incase of rain location will be then be inside on the second floor.
results.name: Harborwalk Sounds Free Concerts Presents: Beneil and His Reggae Orchestra

results.description:
Coding interviews on a whiteboard are a common hiring practice at some of the most selective tech companies. During this meetup, we'll split up with a pool of questions and answers used in interviews for top companies and practice white boarding in front of cranky peers who are constantly second guessing you and asking you to justify every decision. This will be a great opportunity for self assessment and confidence building for those really difficult interviews.

Blade.net has graciously agreed to host this meetup. Light refreshments will be provided. We will be meeting in one of their conference rooms and there are spots for 12 people. We are requiring $10 to register, which will be refunded when you arrive. (the purpose of the $10 is to ensure you aren't flaky because there are many people that end up on the waiting list!)

Please let us know if you're interested in having us host this Meetup again, we're happy to!
results.name: Technical Interview Whiteboarding Practice

results.description:
PLEASE DON'T FORGET TO SIGN UP HERE TO GET ACCESS


About This Event

What good and bad examples of UX come to mind of apps, websites, or other technologies you've used?

We're teaming up with General Assembly to bring in the pros and discuss their thoughts on the subject in an effort to teach others how to do more of what we love in UX/UI and to stop doing what we don't. Look at what happens when good design goes bad. Explore the dark, seamy underbelly of log ins, sign ups and opt outs, how they trick us and what lessons you can learn.

Drinks & networking will follow the talks, so please join us to learn about awesome and not-so-great examples of user experience and user interface design, straight from the experts themselves.

Feature speakers can be seen below, and there will be 2 surprise guests! 

Bill Barnert has a Masters in Human-Computer Interaction from Tufts, and an Sc.B. in Computer Science Engineering from Brown. He has been a User Experience Designer longer than he knew the term existed, designing & implemented user interfaces since 1978.  He sits on the Steering Committee for BostonCHI, and founded the loose umbrella group Boston Interactions. He has a patent pending that he co-designed with Karen Donoghue on a system to allow you to send data to the person you are currently on a mobile call with. 


Syrena Huynh has four years of quantitative research experience in theoretical mathematics and biomedical device design, Syrena embraces her nerdy engineering background as a platform for problem solving and creating best practices. Outside of this sphere, you can find her immersed in an intimate and adventurous relationship with fitness and food – whipping up blackberry black pepper scones in between running a Spartan Race and cycling a century! Syrena holds a BS in Mechanical Engineering from North Carolina State University, with sub-studies in Mathematics and International Studies.
results.name: UX/UI: The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly

results.description:
Satsang is a combination of meditation, spiritual advice, and  questions and answers about life issues and spirituality - relaxing, inspiring, and transformative. Ameeta Kaul is Awake and offers satsang once a month at this location. She is very good at bridging people into their own Truth. Her spiritual teacher is Adyashanti, who is also one of my spiritual teachers. If you are not yet Awake, spending time with people who are will help ripen you for Awakening, and if you are Awake it helps you to embody and deepen your Awakeness.

Suggested Donation $20

Ameeta's description of the event:

"Although the overall theme continues to be Responding to the Call of Truth within, this month's satsang will be dedicated to what seems to be both, a deep yearning, and a living exploration - to be in the world and not of it. At a certain point in the journey perhaps it is seen that this is indeed what we are being called to - to be in the world and not of it. This call is like a guiding star, providing direction to what unfolds in our lives, and yet also presenting many challenges in the reality of its living!

"If this call resonates inside you, a little or a lot, then come join me in satsang. Together let us explore what it means to be in the world and not of it, in earthly activity, in human relationships, and in this life.  Together let us allow the radiance of this call to help us drop our fears and hesitations, and dive deep into the ocean of truth, for in this endeavor we are helped by all who have gone before us, and who shine the light to illuminate our path.

"Satsang will officially begin at 6:45 pm and go up to 8:45 pm. I will be available from 6 pm itself for anybody who wishes to sit or dialogue with me, before the official session.This will not be a private session, but will be in the presence of all who may be  assembled at that time.

"I really look forward to meeting each one who participates. To know more about me please visit www.miraszblog.blogspot.com. If you have questions or seek clarification, please email me [masked]"
results.how_to_find_us: follow signs, the Meetup is upstairs
results.name: Satsang with an Awake Teacher (Ameeta Kaul)

results.description:
This is Four Week Training in Beginners Qi Gong

Join Gifted Qi Gong Instructor Patty Gage for a 4 Week Introduction Practice of Qi Gong - Qi Gong provides a gentle journey relieving the following:

 

(No experience required)
Take control of your health and well-being at any age or fitness level by practicing Qi Gong, a system of Chinese movement that removes energy blockages in the body.  The emphasis of this class is to reduce stress, increase energy, quiet the mind, and enhance the immune system to bring the body into harmony and balance.

Qi Gong increases the body’s energy (Qi) through gentle stretching, low-impact movement, deep rhythmic breathing and acupressure massage. The slow, relaxed movements synchronized with gentle breathing and mindful intent help to relax and release tension, developing a stronger mind/body connection.  Practitioners of Qi Gong report less tension, anxiety, depression, anger, fatigue, and confusion. Practicing Qi Gong can relieve many ailments such as: back, neck and shoulder problems, gastrointestinal conditions, arthritis, fibromyalgia, hypertension, low immune function, headaches, and insomnia.  Therapeutic Qi Gong exercise is a prescription for health, longevity, and happiness.

Bio
Patty Gage is a Certified Qi Gong Instructor trained by Dr. Aihan Kuhn, Qi Gong and Tai Chi Master at Chinese Medicine for Health. Patty was introduced to Qi Gong in 2008 by David Silver, a certified YMAA Qi Gong instructor on Cape Cod, MA and continues to practice with him.
results.name: Qi Gong for Beginners 4 Week Training

results.description:
Matthew Battles discusses Palimpsest: A History of the Written Word

This event is free and includes a book signing; no tickets are required.

Thursday, August 6, 2015, 7pm

Harvard Book Store

1256 Massachusetts Ave., Cambridge

Harvard Book Store welcomes the author of Library: An Unquiet History MATTHEW BATTLES  for a discussion of his latest book, Palimpsest: A History of the Written Word—an eloquent meditation on the history of writing, from Mesopotamia to multimedia. 

Why does writing exist? What does it mean to those who write? Born from the interplay of natural and cultural history, the seemingly magical act of writing has continually expanded our consciousness. Portrayed in mythology as either a gift from heroes or a curse from the gods, it has been used as both an instrument of power and a channel of the divine; a means of social bonding and of individual self-definition. Now, as the revolution once wrought by the printed word gives way to the digital age, many fear that the art of writing, and the nuanced thinking nurtured by writing, are under threat. But writing itself, despite striving for permanence, is always in the midst of growth and transfiguration. 

Celebrating the impulse to record, invent, and make one's mark, Matthew Battles re-enchants the written word for all those susceptible to the power and beauty of writing in all of its forms. 

Featured event books will be for sale at the event for 20% off. Thank you for supporting this author series with your purchases.

General Info: (617)[masked] - [masked] 

Media Inquiries: (617)[masked] x1 - [masked]

We don't have a pool of money for the event. You are responsible for your own consumption and please start and settle your own tab. Please bring your Cash or Credit/Debit card.

RSVP required. Please sign up. If you RSVP "Yes," but your plans change, please change your RSVP to "No" so others can sign up. Deadline for reservation is 3PM as we need to get an accurate head count for the reservation. However, if you'd like to attend, but can't RSVP, send a message to one of the organizers, as we may be able to get you in.

Champions is located at MIT/Kendall Sq. station. If you come from Boston side, you will see right in front of the T exit. It is part of the Marriott. Even though the address is listed as 50 Broadway, you can really only see it from the Main street side.

I have hundreds of games, a full-size pool table, and 15-seat movie theater for PS3 games including BUZZ and ROCK BAND, in addition to movies. This event is open to all members of Unity Games, Metrowest Gamers, MENSA, Meetup, and others. results.description:
Hey Everyone, 

Tired of watching the Celtics games on the couch alone?

Join us at one of the coolest Irish Pubs on the North Shore, and play in a free cornhole tournament, where the winning teams get gift certificates to the Pub/Restaurant. 

Both men and women love playing, and if you don't have a partner, we'll match you up with someone. Many times, we have a random draw for partners. There have been a few couples made from coming to our events. 

The food, beer, and appetizers are great....and they have multiple large TVs to watch the Bruins game while we play. 

Don't miss out on this fun time. 

Tournament starts at 8:00 pm, but you can get there at 7:30pm to practice.
results.how_to_find_us: Just walk in and you will see us throwing bean bags under the big screen TVs.
results.name: Weekly Free Cornhole Tournament at O'neils Pub in Salem. (Prizes for top teams)

RoLa Languages Institute is planning to have a great time with all those who have an interest in speaking French.  There will be many French students as well as a teacher to help, so you can learn from one another.


When?

Thursday, August 6th from 7:30 pm - 10:00 pm


Where?

Pho House, 1790 Massachusetts Avenue (above RoLa's Porter Square office in Cambridge)


What will we do?

We will speak French and have some drinks and food!


Come and join our party! We don't care about who you are, where you're from or how you look! Just come and practice your French! This is a really great chance to improve your French skills! 

It's a free, public event but food and drink purchases are a courteous gesture to the restaurant that hosts us, not to mention delicious!

results.description:
BACK BY POPULAR DEMAND - Let's Talk About Sex and Sacred Sexuality

We'll begin with A Question and Answer Panel with Guest Instructor Maurice Isaiah, Kelle Sparta, and Brynn Bishop.

This class is always one of our most popular ones.  It's your opportunity to set the agenda and finally get to ask the questions you've always wanted to ask.  Nothing is off limits, and we encourage you to dig deep.  YOU bring the questions.... We will do our best to answer each and every one... What are you dying to know about Tantra? About sex? About relationship? About intimacy? About lifestyles? What has you super curious, but there never seems an appropriate place to bring up your inquiry? 

This Thursday night event is your chance!!! Ask away!! And allow 4 Tantrikas to use our life's journey and wisdom and courage to answer anything you throw our way.... we are soooo looking forward to this portion of the evenings' activities...... :)

Then We'll Transition Into Our Presence Practice

The starting point for all Tantric practice is presence.  In the second part of our event, each of us will lead you in a different form of presence practice to get you in the habit of being present with yourself and with a partner.  You'll get a first-hand experience of how to turn your mind off and become present. 

This is a clothes-on, experiential process, perfect for beginners; and great back-to-basics for experienced practitioners.  


About Your Facilitators


Maurice Isaiah is a certified Sexological Bodyworker and Somatic Sex Educator through the Erospirit Research Institute and a member of the Association of Certified Sexological Bodyworkers (ACSB). He has been on the teaching team for Somatic Sex Educator Certification Training at the Institute for Advanced Study of Human Sexuality and the Canadian Training in 2013. He's completed numerous private and group trainings in Tantra and Sacred Intimacy over the past two decades and has facilitated and coached many women’s, men’s and co-ed intimacy groups. He uses body education, coaching and hands on experience to deepen erotic exploration.  He is located in the southern Maine area, near Portland.

Kelle Sparta is a Transformational Shaman specializing in helping people become the heroes of their own lives - creating lives filled with adventure and excitement.  She is a psychic, a medium, a channel, and an energy healer.  Kelle's personal journey with her inner Goddess has taken her on a road through many of the sexual spaces of the world.  She is well-versed in Tantra, swingers clubs, the BSDM and Fetish worlds, polyamory, long-term and short-term monogamy, casual sex, sacred sex (and casual, sacred sex), sexual healing, bisexuality, threesomes, foursomes, and moresomes.  Kelle can speak to you about sex from a wide range of personal experience - don't hesitate to ask ANYTHING.  Kelle's work is all around empowering you to choose the life YOU want to lead.  www.KelleSparta.com


Brynn Bishop, founder of Conscious Intimacy, is a Certified Tantra Educator and Intimacy Coach with over twenty-five years experience. Brynn specializes in guiding individuals in their relational and sexual empowerment. It is her great joy, honor and privilege to help men and women reclaim their voice, their desire and their pleasure. Her unique approach weaves together cutting edge Somatic Psychology and Trauma Resolution, Conscious Communication, and Toaist and Tantric Healing Arts and Sexual Awakening practices. This powerful syntheses provides the most effective methods of healing, transformation and empowerment. Brynn has been featured on numerous radio and TV programs, including Sex for Her Health and Happiness! Her work has been touted as “enlightening, transformative, empowering, heart-opening and deeply nourishing.” In both her workshops and private sessions, Brynn is known for her welcoming, compassionate presence and her contagious enthusiasm. She teaches nationally and maintains a private practice in Boston, MA and via phone and Skype.
results.name: Ask A Tantrika - Q&A Panel and Presence Practice with Guest Maurice Isaiah

results.description:
What if Hansel and Gretel got lost in Boston instead of the woods? This classic tale along with other favorites come into a different light with Fractured Fairy Tales. After a five-year hiatus, Theatre@First presents the return of the short play festival at Boston's Unity Church. Chosen from 300 submissions around the globe, Fractured Fairy Tales gathers nine fairy tale retellings that will expand your world of magic and wonder. This year's tales also feature a grad student interviewing Disney princesses, a 10-year-old girl facing the monster under her bed and Goldilocks and the Big Bad Wolf in an alternate noir universe. Watch as "tales as old as time" take on a new life of their own.


If you're interested in coming, please pre-purchase your ticket for $7.50 here:

http://www.goldstar.com/events/somerville-ma/fractured-fairy-tales-tickets

Please RSVP if you plan to come. If you RSVP, I'll be waiting to hear from you, so please show up, or let me know if circumstances change! If you ditch us without warning a few times, we'll have to remove you from the group. If you need to get a hold of me, my number is four four zero 488-5055.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet outside the church a little before the play and enjoy the play!
results.name: Fractured Fairy Tales

results.description:
Shakespeare on the Common: A Boston summer tradition since 1996, CSC has been presenting FREE fully-staged productions of Shakespeare plays to Boston audiences.


For our 20th season production of Free Shakespeare on the Common, CSC is pleased to present King Lear for the very first time. King Lear follows the journey of an aging king, faced with his own mortality and mental decline, who tries to secure the legacy of his kingdom by dividing it amongst his three daughters. Only through loss—of status, of love, of loyalty—does King Lear learn what is truly resonant at the end of a life.

Bring dinner with you if you aren't eating somewhere else first. Bring a chair (low preferred otherwise you have to sit somewhere else) (or you can rent one for $5) - and/or a blanket to sit on. Let's gather around 6:30 -6:45PM to get a good spot. I will stake out a spot on the common and give you my phone # so you can find me. I will wear a hat with a Meetup sign on it to make life easier.  

If it's raining, we cancel. (The show will be canceled in the event of rain anyway.)

Park St. is the nearest T stop! This is a free performance although donations are always welcome.
results.name: Shakespeare on the Common: King Lear

***REGISTRATION closes 45 minutes prior to the webcast.***  Please make sure you sign-up on our website at least 45 mins prior to the webcast to receive your live log-in link via email.


(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>)


The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the essential life energy within.

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru
results.name: An Introduction to Inner Engineering--FREE Class (Online Webinar)

results.description:
Al Green has, slowly and surely developed (like a photograph) a style that is not quite techno and not quite house. Born from a thirst for innovation within drum and bass, Green and his contemporaries dBridge and Jon Convex pushed the sound forward and eventually drove him to create Boddika: A genreless moniker committed to doing things differently.

So you get things like "Acid Jackson." Or, with his good friend Joy Orbison, things like "Dun Dun" and "Mercy." What genre is it? Who cares. Does it bring the club to a boil faster than a tin pan on a bonfire? It sure does. As a producer, he practically defines the process to make it new. As a DJ, he brings it to life.

It's been a long-time coming:

MAKE IT NEW WITH BODDIKA
w/ resident DJs Coralcola and Baltimoroder
Thu August 6th
Middlesex Lounge
614 Mass Ave.
21+/9pm
$15 before 11pm / $20
results.name: Make It New with Boddika

results.description:
The Highland Street Foundation is giving free entrance to museums and parks throughout the summer.

(See the complete list of free activities here)

Today, free roundtrip (usually $17 per island) ferry rides are available to either (or both) of the two most popular Boston Harbor Islands – Georges Island (with historic Fort Warren, Plays in the Park, and ranger-guided tours) and Spectacle Island (with a life-guard supervised beach and 5 miles of hiking trails).


Free roundtrip tickets for the Boston Harbor Cruises ferry will be distributed on a first come, first serve basis at Long Wharf-North, 66 Long Wharf, in downtown Boston (near the Aquarium subway station) and Christopher Columbus Park.

The ticket window will open at 7:00 am.


The ferry leaves every 30 minutes from Boston Long Wharf with first at 8:00 am and the last at 2 pm.

The ferry leaves every 30 minutes from Georges Island to Boston Long Wharf with first at 9:00 am and last at 3:00 pm.

Each adult in line may pick up a maximum of 4 tickets. (There will be no special arrangements for groups of more than 4 to be on the same ferry).


Tickets will be handed out for the earliest ferry, then the next, and so on, until all ferry seats for the day are distributed.

You will then need to stand in line for the ferry you want to take which means arrive for the 1:00 pm ferry at 12:45 pm.

While there is a place to grill and a cafe on Georges Island, Tiffany recommends bringing your own lunch and snacks to be safe.
results.how_to_find_us: Call 617 445 7549 with questions or to find us.
results.name: FREE Day Trip to George's Island and/or Spectacle Island

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball.

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Friday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

results.description:
Hey guys!

As you know, I will be studying abroad in Spain from August 15th-December 22nd. I have had an incredible experience being apart of this group and have made so many great friends. I have completely fallen in love with Japanese people, the language and culture. It's funny how I finally find a group that I really connect with and then have to leave so soon... But it's not over yet my friends :)

I will be throwing a huge Japanese food and language party at my house on August 7th and everyone is welcome to come. We will have an incredible selection of authentic Japanese dishes that are near impossible to find in Boston without spending a fortune. We will be able to talk, eat and exchange cultures! It will be awesome!

I wish I could fund everything for the party but Boston has has been rough on me. If everyone could bring just $10 it would be enough for all of the food, drink and accessories. I assure you it will be amazing :)

My apartment is located in Roxbury, MA about a 10 minute walk from the Stony Brook Station on the Orange line. I believe I can accommodate 40-50 people but I'm not entirely sure as I have never thrown a party of this size! 

If anyone has any question don't hesitate to ask! I'm really looking forward to seeing everyone there!!!
results.name: 日本のパーティー！

results.description:
For New Members AND NON-Members:

For every sailor who walks through our door, start here! This FREE Orientation class will get you familiar with how everything works at CBI. The orientation class is the gateway to everything that CBI has to offer, whether you’re a seasoned sailor or brand new to boats. Done entirely on the dock, your orientation will include a guided tour of CBI’s boats and facilities, an overview of our classes and programs, as well as plenty of time to ask the questions that matter to you as a sailor. All orientations meet at the base of the American Flag Pole out on the dock, and runs for about half an hour. All are welcome to this class!


Afterwards, we invite you to meet one another and ask about other Orientation class attendees' prior experience with sailing. Perhaps you can find a friend to take the Beginner Sailing classes together with once you join. 

Friday Nights are also when CBI members go out for Informal Racing, so it is an exciting night to watch the sailors and learn more about how you can progress your skills after learning to sail. Certainly ask your Orientation instructor about the Friday Night Informal Racing and Informal Instruction if he or she does not mention it. If you have any questions, please feel free to post below!
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.community-boating.org/about-us/hours-and-directions/
results.name: FREE Orientation Class at Community Boating

TARGET AUDIENCE: All Members of ALL AGES that like Art and a relaxed social atmosphere!

Admission: $25 per person -- Free for MFA Members. ...If you are an MFA members please try to arrange through comments to help get other members of our group in as your guest for free. You can also try to get a discount pass at your local library get you in for free or $10 a Person. Hey we all need to save a few bucks for drink later right?

Drop off your coats, buy your entry tickets and meet us all at the SHARF VISITOR CENTER at 5:45PM. After that try to find us in the Ruth and Carl J. Shapiro Family Courtyard its where the party is at. and it the big tall room with the huge green glass Chihuly art piece is in. Stay as long as you want. MFA First Fridays ends at 9PM the Museum closed at 9:45PM.

MFA First Fridays is on the first Friday of each month from 6:00–9:30 pm. Join us for fine art, music, cash bars featuring signature cocktails, and delicious tapas available for purchase. Open to visitors 21+. Valid ID with proof of age required for entry.

Accepted forms of identification for First Friday entrance include:
Massachusetts Drivers License
Massachusetts Liquor ID
Massachusetts ID issued by the Massachusetts Registry of Motor Vehicles
Drivers License from any US state
Valid Passport (photocopies are not accepted)
Federal Identification (e.g. Military ID)

We can mix and mingle with fellow art lovers,  enjoy the art,  the music and sip on our lovely drinks. hen we can break off and look at some more art since the rest of the museum is open!

Hope you can make it out this fine Friday Evening out for some Art Culture and great conversations.

======================================================

Notes for Parking for the MFA: It will be busy and lots tend to fill up fast so try to get there early! Taking the T is your best bet!

Self Parking Options: Visitors to the MFA have three self-parking options: the Huntington Lot, the Fenway Lot, and the Museum Road Garage, all of which have entrances on Museum Road. The Huntington lot offers closer parking to the Huntington Avenue Entrance and the Fenway parking lot is more accessible to the State Street Corporation Fenway Entrance. MFA lost Park costs $$$ over $20 so be prepared.

Subway Take the Green Line E train to the Museum of Fine Arts stop, or the Orange Line train to the Ruggles stop.

WBZ NewsRadio 1030 and the Department of Conservation and Recreation host the 30th Annual Free Fridays flicks movie series at the DCR Hatch Shell. Free Friday flicks start at dusk (8:15+ as the summer goes along) but activities and fun kick off at 6 p.m. on Fridays this summer!

Free Friday Flicks is a summertime tradition in Boston, attracting thousands of movie-goers to enjoy family-oriented feature length movies under the stars all summer long at DCR’s Hatch Shell in Boston! Bring a blanket or lawn chair, pack a picnic, and watch a movie with family and friends on Friday night for free! Movies begin at sundown, but arrive early to grab your spot on the lawn and enjoy free food samples, games, and giveaways with WBZ NewsRadio 1030 – the fun

results.description:
Let's do it again!

We'll play some board games and whatever other games you bring and would like to play. A sample of what we play (but are not limited to):
Rummikub
Guesstures
Taboo
Chinese Checkers
Mexican Train Game
Scattegories
Boggle
Apples to Apples (and Cards against Humanity if we dare!)

Oh, and Michigan Rummy for nickels of course! I will explain the game to those who haven't played it before, or for many decades! It's the easy card game you may have played with your grandparents on lazy summer days...well, we play for nickels rather than poker chips. We start with $4 in nickels, everyone brings his/her own nickels.

This is a great venue for games with Fuddruckers for dinner, Richardson's Ice Cream for Dessert and Beantown Jelly Beans for a yummy snack.

results.description:
The Museum of Fine Arts is open from 6PM to 9:30PM on first Fridays. The entire museum is open. In the Shapiro Courtyard (the indoor courtyard with the Chihuly green glass Christmas Tree and the restaurant) the MFA sets up a cash bar and a DJ. From 6PM its mostly at 40-60 set to talk. After about 7PM the volume of the music goes up, the 25-35 year olds arrive, and the event shifts from talk to dancing. The place often fills up a bit after 7, so don’t be later than that.

http://www.mfa.org/programs/special-event/mfa-first-fridays

Museum admission and event ticketing. The event is free with museum admission, either for members or general admission ($25, $23 for seniors), either at the door or online at http://www.mfa.org/visit. Many local libraries sell discounted tickets, for example two tickets for $10. Also, many employers may have discounted or even free tickets for their employees, check your human resources department.

First Friday is separately ticketed (at no additional charge), even if you are a member or preticketed.  You need to go through the admission line to get a separate ticket.  The line is tolerable at 6:00PM, and way way bad at 6:10.

If people have dual memberships they can get others in for free. As we gather at the front lobby, we can figure out any ticket sharing arrangements.

Open to visitors 21+. Valid ID with proof of age required for entry.

It's not complicated.  Just show up and find one or another of the Meetup groups.  Someone will point you to the right lines to stand in, and maybe share a ticket.


Transportation. Public transportation strongly recommended, parking is a pain. The Green E line stops right in front of the museum. Also there are several buses that also stop in front of the museum. Directions by every transportation mode at http://www.mfa.org/visit/getting-here, www.mbta.com .

Meeting up with others—how to find us. The Fine Culture in Boston and Culture Vultures groups meet in the Huntington Avenue main entrance lobby at 6PM near the statue of Orpheus and Cerberus (3 headed dog). Then we will head in at 6:10.

If you arrive later, as you enter the courtyard, look to your left, and meet us at the tables near the elevator station with the poster of the current show.

Please change your RSVP if you can not make it.

After. The event closes at 9:30.  We can go out after for food or drinks at a convenient location, such as a restaurant on Huntington Ave.
results.name: MFA First Friday—Conversation, Art, Music, Dancing

group.name: Fine Culture in Boston (and International Travel)

results.description:
The Museum of Fine Arts hosts a DJ with dancing, a cash bar and tapas on the  first Friday of every month.  You can also go straight to the art galleries and wander in and out as you like.

Admission is $25 and includes the galleries (free for members).

Advance tickets are available, recommended as the event can sell out. Members may order free tickets by logging in or signing up on the MFA website, and non-members may purchase tickets that include general Museum admission. Tickets may also be available in person on the day of the event, first come, first served.

You must be 21+ to enter the courtyard so don’t forget proper ID!

MFA First Friday info:

http://www.mfa.org/programs/special-event/mfa-first-fridays-0
results.how_to_find_us: Will be waiting around the couches in the information area (just past the rotunda) until ~ 6:15.  Several groups usually attend.  Look for the Meetup people at the long table to the left of the entrance to the party area.
results.name: Dancing at First Friday at the MFA

group.name: Karaoke, Live Music & Dancing...Boston at it's best!

results.description:
This is a good event, you can be as social or un-social as you prefer.  Go to the art galleries, or there is a  cash bar, tapas for purchase, and dancing to music provided by a DJ in the courtyard, you may wander in and out as you like.

Admission is $25 and includes the galleries (free for members).

Advance tickets are available, suggested as the event can sell out. Members may order free tickets by logging into the MFA website, and non-members may purchase tickets that include general Museum admission. Tickets also available in person on the day of the event, first come, first served.

http://www.mfa.org/programs/special-event/mfa-first-fridays-0

You must be 21+ to enter the courtyard, don’t forget proper ID!

Finding us:  There are usually Meetups in the back (to the left as you enter) with signs on tables, I’ll start there to greet people - if your profile has a pic I'll look for you.  Later I’ll be dancing – come to the dance floor and join in, or wander around the galleries and look at art.


*If you have a membership that allows for guests please feel free to post in the event discussion. Discount tickets can be found at your local library/or through other members who also have a museum membership. I don't know if these allow for First Friday admission.
The event has a max attendance of 400 people, and does sell out so, get there before 7:15 or take your chances.


The MFA is on the Green Line and there is also parking in the neighborhood.
results.how_to_find_us: Keep in mind that this is a crowded, busy event.  I will start in the rotunda (straight past the coat check) or just through into the information area by the couches.  Around 6:00 we'll go in, or people can split off to view the galleries.
results.name: Museum of Fine Arts First Fridays

results.description:
ART, MUSIC, DANCING

Let's meet out in the lobby in front at the main entrance at 6pm. near the statue of Orpheus and Cerberus (3 headed dog). Then we will head in at 6:10 to make sure we get in. We will congregate and get some tables to the left near the big cube with the poster, which has the stairs and the elevator behind it.

Try not to be late, as it fills up quickly and then they stop letting people in. I am BIll, 6'4".

The cost of museum entry is $25, but if people  have dual memberships they can get others in for free, so if you have a dual let us know via meetup comments, or RSVP comment.

I will usually email my phone # before the event to attendees so if you miss us in the foyer you can call or text (preferred) if you can't find us when/if you get in.   Look at everyone's pictures so we know who is going.  I will try to bring a copy of the pictures and will keep an eye out to say hi & introduce people.

BE SURE TO GET THERE EARLY, AS THE PLACE FILLS UP AND THEY TURN PEOPLE AWAY.  You need a license or Mass ID to enter.

Please change your RSVP if you can not make it.

We can go out after for food or drinks at a convenient location, such as a restaurant on Huntington Ave.
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet in the Front Lobby, off Huntington Ave., at 6PM, by the statue of Orpheus and Cerebus (3 headed dog).  We will go in at 6:10pm.
results.name: MFA First Friday

results.description:
Dear Boston Culture Lovers,

Join us at the MFA First Friday.

You will be able to enjoy fine art, music, cash bars featuring signature cocktails, and delicious tapas available for purchase.

Open to visitors 21+. Valid ID with proof of age required for entry.

Tickets

For Members, you may order free tickets for this event on the MFA web site.

For non-members, you may purchase your tickets that include general Museum admission in person on the day of the event on a first come, first served basis, or in advance, online.

For discounted/free tickets. The cost of general admission is $25 ($23 for seniors). However, you may be able to get a discounted ticket at your local library.

Your local library most likely has discounted passes available. Typically the discount is two tickets at $10 per admission. Also, many employers may have discounted or even free tickets for their employees. You may want to check your human resources department if such discounted/free tickets exist for you.

The MFA website strongly recommends that you purchase your tickets in advance due to the risk of this event selling out. I heard that this event rarely sells out, however it sometimes happens in the summer months. I just wanted to give you fair warning.

The plan is to meet at 6pm in lounge/couch area of the Sharf Visitor Center on the first floor. Otherwise, at 6 :15 pm sharp, we walk a few steps away into the main social event at the Shapiro Courtyard.

Since this event will be a somewhat crowded and roaming , it will be very difficult for latecomers to connect with the group. If you are late, I can not guarantee that you will recognize me or fellow members or we to be able recognize you from the crowds. Once the event starts, I put away my smartphone and concentrate on enjoying the event with fellow group members. Please plan ahead and allow a little extra travel time to this event. Typically, there are a lot Meetup groups present. There are usually Meetup signs posted at the tables near the entrance to the courtyard. If you are late, don't be shy and introduce yourself. A lot of attendees are regulars and will most likely point you other members of the group.

If you need to familiarize yourself to this location, here is a link to the floor plan: http://mfas3.s3.amazonaws.com/Map_Sept2014_level1.pdf

I strongly recommend that you take public transportation, the Green E line stops right in front of the museum. Also there are several buses that also stop in front of the museum. Check out these links for more information on getting to the museum: http://www.mfa.org/visit/getting-here, www.mbta.com .

Please only reserve "YES" if you are definitely attending and plan to meet members of the group. If you reserve "YES" and have a change of plans, please update the attendance reservation.

I look forward to enjoying this event with the group.

Joana

http://mfas3.s3.amazonaws.com/styles/grid-3_thumbnail_retina/s3/mfa-summer-fridays-landing-page_0.jpg?itok=i2jETF4C
results.how_to_find_us: 6pm at the Sharf Visitor Center couch/lounge area

results.description:
All around the metro, an ongoing conversation is happening about Boston Creates, the first-ever arts and culture plan for the City of Boston.

What is Boston Creates?
Over the next 15 months, Boston Creates will provide an opportunity for Boston’s many communities and neighborhoods to create a cultural blueprint highlighting Boston’s strengths and setting innovative goals for the future. We’ll look at community organizations and individual artists; cultural spaces and facilities; our cultural heritage and communities; our festivals and events; and creative industries and occupations. Mmmmaven is happy to host this event and it is free and open to the public with RSVP. Space is limited so be sure to get involved early.

This is an official government campaign and your voice will be heard. If you've ever wanted to get your feedback, advice and explore the future of Boston's arts and culture, this would be the time to do that. Notes and feedback will be officially submitted to the process.

If you live, work, go out in or participate in Boston's culture, you're welcome to join.

BOSTON CREATES MEET-UP
Friday, August 7th
Mmmmaven Project
615 Massachusetts Ave, #203
7pm-8pm
Free with RSVP

results.description:
The End of the Tour Advanced Tickets.  Always better safe than sorry.

The End of the Tour tells the story of the five-day interview between Rolling Stone reporter (and novelist) David Lipsky (Jesse Eisenberg) and acclaimed novelist David Foster Wallace (Jason Segel), which took place right after the 1996 publication of Wallace’s groundbreaking epic novel, Infinite Jest.


As the days go on, a tenuous yet intense relationship seems to develop between journalist and subject. The two men bob and weave around each other, sharing laughs and also possibly revealing hidden frailties – but it’s never clear how truthful they are being with each other. Ironically, the interview was never published, and five days of audio tapes were packed away in Lipsky’s closet. The two men did not meet again. The film is based on Lipsky’s critically acclaimed memoir about this unforgettable encounter, written following Wallace’s 2008 suicide. Both Segel and Eisenberg reveal great depths of emotion in their performances and the film is directed with humor and tenderness by Sundance vet James Ponsoldt from Pulitzer- Prize winner Donald Margulies’ insightful and heartbreaking screenplay.

For those unfamiliar with David Foster Wallace, here is a link to his commencement address, 'This is Water' on YouTube.

Following the film and credits, we'll meet on the street corner in front of the Coolidge to go to Osaka Japanese Steakhouse and Sushi for dinner and discussion of all things DFW.

See you at the movies,

John
results.how_to_find_us: John will gather the group AFTER close of credits on the sidewalk on the corner of the Coolidge Corner Theater.  He will be flashing an authentic, antique, homemade Meetup Sign.  We'll go to Osaka for dinner and discussion of all things DFW..
