On the first Friday of every month, approximatly 60 professional artist studios open their studios to the public to show and tell. It's a great opportunity to discuss art that we see: oil painting, watercolor, photography, sculpture--which express social messages, faith, feelings and other forms of human expression.

If you are Christian, enjoy free  beer and wine, and like discussing art with artists with this no cost event, join us!

About the host: I've been a practicing Christian for twenty years. One of my passions is viewing all forms of art as human expression. I'm involved with landscape photography in which I sell my prints. I like hanging out with other Christians, who enjoy viewing art and culture.

For more info, check out: www.sowaartistsguild.com

"The Hiroshima & Nagasaki 70th Observance Concert"
is being offered as an opportunity to gather, reflect, and meditate
on the atomic bombings of August 6 and 9, 1945.

The tragic effect of these events continues to be significant,
even to this to this day.
So we gather to remember and to celebrate
the healing power of music, community, and our wonderfully enduring cultures.

Featuring:

***Chorus Boston 
Singing contemporary and traditional Japanese music 

***Elizabeth Bennett, shakuhachi

***Aaron Larget-Caplan, classical guitar
playing selections from 'The Legend of Hagomoro'. 

***Ambient 'Steel Cello', Peter Warren, and Matt Samolis,
Meditative ambient soundscapes from an acoustic 'Steel Cello’

Suggested Donation: $10 (could leave less, which would be "under $10")

For more info/Questions CONTACT:

READ THIS: IN ORDER TO PARTICIPATE IN THE INTIMATE PUJA CIRCLE YOU MUST RESERVE YOUR SPOT VIA PAYPAL.  SIMPLE RSVP-ing ON MEETUP IS NOT A COMPLETE REGISTRATION. THANK YOU FOR UNDERSTANDING!  <3

REGISTER by CLICKING HERE<a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=6CAU9BRFZPDKN"></a>

_____________________________________________

A Puja, in sanskrit, means reverence, honor, worship and adoration.  It's used by the Hindus, Sikhs, Buddhists, and others -- as a ceremony to honor a very special occasion; it's also used more often as part of a sacred ritual/practice to support opening to the wisdom of the Divine -- your Source.

_________________________________________

Here's what we are going to do:

_________________________________________

Intimate Puja Circles, created by Robyn Vogel, Come Back to Love Coach, is the place to:

• Be playful with other yummy, juicy, soulful singles, and couples

• Learn and practice Tantra, yoga, meditation, et al....

• Be in a room with folks who are willing to be honest, and open their hearts

• Experience deep connections with those interested in sacred sexuality, expanded orgasm, conscious relationship, spirituality  - people like YOU!

Tantric Intimacy (whether you are single or in relationship):

This special evening will begin with many invitations to connect with each other in light and playful ways -- always with the opportunity to go as deep as you choose.  Single or coupled, you'll experience Tantric Intimacy exercises as a way to say 'hello', get to know one another, mingle and connect. 

Here's what participants are saying!

"Thank you so much, Robyn!  I'm learning so much about myself through these Pujas and because of them would never have met my PARTNER!  Woo hoo!"

"The class was great; I  really enjoyed it. Very different from my normal way of life, you did create on a small scale what I was hoping for....creating the possibility to feel a deeper intimacy."

"It's so amazing to walk into a room of "strangers" and walk out feeling in love with everyone!"

"I didn't think I'd be able to connect with anyone there.  I was so surprised, and delighted, how easy it was to enjoy myself with every man in that room! Thank you Robyn, for your excellent facilitation skills. I felt totally safe!"

"We have to wait a whole month until the next one????"

"This is a very special event; a non-threatening, yet deep and authentic way to meet others. I've been online dating for years and it's just not for me.  I've met some really good people at your events."

"We love to come as a couple and meet others on a similar path."

"....and to think, they are happening RIGHT HERE in Boston!!


The Intimate Puja Circle itself will begin part-way through the night during which you'll have the chance to connect more deeply with others (one-on-one) -- this part of the evening will be facilitated, with a structure offered, however, you will have ample time to co-create with the beloved in front of you!!  You will be at choice and encouraged to ask for 100% of what you want.

Relax on a Friday night:

Once the formal part of the evening is over, there'll be time to dance, hang out, cuddle, snuggle, relax, process, and rest.  There will always be chocolate!

Q&A

1.  What if I'm in relationship? Being in relationship definitely does not exclude you from coming to the Intimate Puja Circle. These rituals will be invitations to connect with yourself and one another - and you will be at choice as to how you do that.  There are typically a mix of singles and couples at the events.

2.  What should I wear? Please be comfortable but also celebratory!  Wear yoga pants or something with a draw string around the waist; bring sarongs, scarves, dresses, etc.

3.  Do I need to bring anything? Yes, FRIENDS!!  And your water bottle.  You are also welcome healthy snacks to share after the Puja.  Organic fruit and chocolate are best.

4.  What if I have questions, I'm feeling a bit nervous: Please email me to set up a time to talk:  [masked]

Please note RSVPing on this Meetup site will not reserve you a space. The Intimate Puja Circles are limited in size so please pay in advance to reserve your space (and SAVE MONEY.)

REGISTER HERE

**  Coming to an Intimate Puja Circle enables you to participate in our secret FB group as well as receive a special VIP invitation to the upcoming Intimate Puja Weekend Retreat this September.**

results.description:
Friday nights are generally for more experienced students, as we work through some different parts of Fiore's works in a more open format.  New students should take our beginners' class first, or contact our instructors for more information.  We're happy to have visiting scholars from other programs come and play!

We practice L'Arte D'Armizare (The Art of Bearing Arms), a historical European martial art. Our main sources of interpretation are the books (c[masked]) of Fiore dei Liberi, a fencing master from Friuli (thus the non-standard Italian spellings!).

Our students work on a combination of longsword, abrazzare (grappling), daga (dagger/knife) and other weapon skills. These skills are drawn from direct translation from historical sources, developed through multiple physical interpretations and tested at speed. Though we emphasize historical technique, our training sessions are a blend of warmup, interpretation, drill, and for men and women who've passed our safety standards, both focused and open sparring.
results.how_to_find_us: Come around to the right side of the building.  The stairs will bring you to the door.
results.name: (Newton) Intermediate Longsword, Dagger and Grappling

"The Hiroshima & Nagasaki 70th Observance Concert" is being offered as an opportunity to gather, reflect, and meditate on the atomic bombings of August 6th and 9th, 1945.

The tragic effect of these events continues to be significant, even to this to this day. So we gather to remember and to celebrate the healing power of music, community, and our wonderfully enduring cultures.

Featuring:

***Chorus Boston
Singing contemporary and traditional Japanese music


***Elizabeth Bennett, shakuhachi

***Aaron Larget-Caplan, classical guitar playing selections from 'The Legend of Hagomoro'.


***Ambient 'Steel Cello', Peter Warren & Matt Samolis, Meditative ambient soundscapes from an acoustic 'Steel Cello’.

Suggested Donation: $10

For more info/Questions CONTACT: Matt Samolis[masked][masked]

results.description:
Here's the game plan:

8:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

8:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

8:20 - Play!!!!!!

10:00 - Conclude the meetup and begin socializing.

Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white and a dark-colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a light or dark "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!
results.how_to_find_us: The field is a two-minute walk from Alewife station on the Red Line. There is also plenty of parking provided no one else is using the field. (Not an issue in the winter.)

results.description:
Fridays, March – mid-November | 8:30 – 10:00 pm
Offering Format: Public Event
Recommended for grades Pre-K – 12 and adults
Museum of Science
Free

Did you know that the Museum offers our starry-eyed public a free evening full of astronomy-themed fun on weather-cooperative Fridays?

Between 8:30pm and 10pm each Friday, weather-permitting, visit the Gilliland Observatory on the roof of the Museum’s parking garage. On clear nights, you can view stars, planets, the Moon, and other astronomical phenomena. On cloudy nights, tour the inside of our Observatory, and participate in astronomy-related activities run by our knowledgeable staff.

This program does not run on nights when the weather is inclement. For more details, and to find out if Astronomy After Hours is running on a given Friday, call our hotline,[masked]-0267. We update each Friday by 5:30pm with the evening’s plans.

Astronomy After Hours runs seasonally, from the first Friday in March to the last Friday before Thanksgiving. Admission is free thanks to the generosity of the Lowell Institute (parking charges still apply).

Thanks to Don Doughty for letting us know about the museum.

Source: http://www.mos.org/public-events/astronomy-after-hours
results.name: Astronomy After Hours - Museum of Science

results.description:
Please note the change of time. We are starting earlier in the morning to finish the run before it gets hot :-).  

Group run logistics: Please come prepared for a short run (or run/walk). Leave your bags, etc. at home or in your car so that you can run easily. Please make sure to arrive 10 minutes early to look for parking, find the location, etc. 
Coach will brief you at the beginning of the run about the distance and direct you through stretching exercises. It is absolutely OK to run/walk in the beginning. Many of us are first-time runners. So please don’t be shy :-). 

Program details:  TeamAIDAsha is a beginner-friendly marathon/half-marathon training and fund-raising program. We train runners for their full or half marathon races and runners raise donations for AID and Asha. Both beginner and experienced runners are welcome. Anyone is welcome to RSVP and join us for the group runs up to four time with no obligations. We request formal registrations after attending four group runs.

If you missed the information session you can get an overview of this training and fund-raising program from here.

Looking for more runners: We are always looking for more runners. If any of your friends, family members or colleagues to give us a try and join this meetup group.


Waiver: Lawyers make us do this :-).  By running with TeamAIDAsha program you are agreeing to our official waiver at: http://www.teamaidasha.org/waiver.html


About AID-Boston

Association for India's Development (AID) is a non-profit, volunteer movement committed to promoting sustainable, equitable and just development, especially at India’s grassroots. We meet once a week at MIT. Anyone is welcome to attend. Visit AID-Boston at: www.aidboston.org

About Asha-MIT

Asha tries to catalyze socio-economic change in India through education of underprivileged children. We meet once a month at MIT. Anyone is welcome to attend. Visit Asha Boston/MIT at: http://www.ashanet.org/mit/
results.how_to_find_us: Look for a group of runners and volunteers

results.description:
Want to hike with us? Follow the instructions below very carefully.

MT. MADISON & ADAMS THE HARD WAY--MADISON GULF up/ HOWKER RIDGE down. (ADVANCED) Alpine zone, tough rock scrambles, glacial cirques, Star Lake, Madison Hut, 2 peaks on the 4,000 list, 1 trail on the "Terrifying 25" list, Great Gulf Wilderness, waterfalls, more natural beauty than you can shake a stick at--'nuff said. 

INSTRUCTIONS: You must answer the RSVP questions--failure to respond will result in your RSVP being deleted. Equivalent recent hiking experience is also required. Everyone will be waitlisted until responses are screened. You must also have your preferences for this Meetup set to receive messages from other members, in case I have further questions for you. 

DIFFICULTY: Advanced. DISTANCE: about 12.3 miles. Significant alpine exposure, very steep rock scrambles, rugged terrain. PACE: Moderate,[masked]mph. We take breaks and stop to take in the views and appreciate natural features. HIKING TIME is relative. Plan on a full day of hiking. We will most likely exit before dark but bring a headlamp just in case. GEAR (read carefully): Pack for alpine travel--bring light and heavy layers, full rain gear, warm hat, sun hat, fleece, sunscreen, bug dope, emergency shelter or sleeping bag, 1st aid kit, headlamp with spare batteries, plenty of food and water for the entire day. NO COTTON CLOTHING WHATSOEVER.   

MEETING PLACE & ITINERARY**:  8:00AM sharp, we will not wait long for stragglers. Meet at the Howker Ridge Trailhead, Dolly Copp Road, just off Route 2 in Randolph, NH. We spot cars there, then drive to the southern Great Gulf Trailhead across from Camp Dodge on Route 16.  We hike through the lower Great Gulf Wilderness then ascend steeply with rock scrambles through the difficult Madison Gulf to treeline at lovely Star Lake. If the weather is good, we'll climb Adams, then Madison and descend over the rocky roller-coastery Howker Ridge. We pass two waterfalls on the descent to our car spot.  

What the group will expect of you: Humanity humility and cooperation. This is a social experience. We hike together/stick together as a group at the pace of the slowest member. No freewheelin.'

Rain or shine event-- Extreme weather will cancel. As usual, we do not wimp out about weather forecasts until 24 hours before the event--things can change quickly. I will post updates on weather. No Guests--have your guests sign up and RSVP, please. NO Dogs due to terrain challenges not suitable for most dogs. This trip limited to 10 participants to responsibly reduce impacts to habitat, trails, and the experience of other hikers.

Carpools: Indicate your carpool preference on the discussion board.

(In other words, you may be hiking with us but you and you alone are responsible for your personal safety. The host of this event is a facilitator not a guide or a trip leader).

May the Force be with you.

RSVP QUESTION:

1) Indicate you have read and understand with the full event description with disclaimer and have the necessary gear and experience to do this hike at the pace described. 

2). Please provide your full name, phone number and the name and number of an emergency contact person. Disclose any medical condition that could limit your ability to participate safely in this event. 

3) This hike requires a car spot. If you are driving you're agreeing to assist with this by leaving half of your car seats empty. 

4) Describe what you have hiked in the last three months. Provide details on pace, distance, etc. If I cannot be sure of your experience, I'll pass you by. 

**Your event host reserves the right to alter the itinerary before or during this event based on prevailing circumstances and conditions. Your flexibility is appreciated and required. The itinerary of this trip is a Hobson's Choice.

results.description:
This is the reoccurring meetup for the weekly open water swims at Walden Pond. A well attended venue for triathletes training for races of all distances.

The gate opens at 7 a.m. and the Parking is right off of Walden St. Walden charges to park a their lot ($5) via a computerized parking attendant that takes cards. I'd recommend the annual pass if you think you're going to come to more meetups. Alternatively, It's a short distance from Concord High School. Some people avoid the parking fee by parking near Concord High School and then walk/ride their bike over to Walden. Click here for the map of the parking.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Across and back from the beach (Pictured above) is a little over a mile mile; a perfect distance for those training for 70.3 and Ironman races.

There are also some close to shore routes for people getting better acquainted with open water (see distance maps). We meet near the lifeguard house right on the beach closes to Walden street. Here is the map of walden pond.

This meetup is important because you always want to swim in groups if you can. Make certain that you look out for each other. Don't attempt to swim across the pond if you haven't trained for that distance. Always match up with someone or a group that swims your pace. The beauty of Walden is that you can swim very close to shallow water and get some good open water training in.

If there are people that are looking to go long for the first time, let me know in advance and I may be able to swim angel, or get a swim angel group together. That way we can do it in a controlled and safe environment.

For those that are really new and nervous about open water swimming, stay tuned for a beginners clinic that I'll put on in the summer.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be by the Lifeguard house
results.name: Weekly Walden Open Water Swim

results.description:
This is always a great ride! Flat paved road, all bike types welcome.

MV bike path: http://www.marthasvineyardbike.com/marthas-vineyard-bike-trail-map.pdf

Schedule/Transportation- use the Steamship Authority ferry (SCHEDULE) from Woods Hole.

https://www.steamshipauthority.com/writable/versioned_downloadable_schedules/path/2015_mv06.pdf


$8.50 one way per person, $4 one way for bike. We will take the ferry to Oak Bluffs. 

**Bring helmet, water and a snack, we will most likely stop along the way to get something to eat.

There is bike rental and they deliver to where you are but it is expensive ($25 day), you can reserve online. 
http://www.marthasvineyardbike.com/marthas-vineyard-bike-rentals.php

**Rain, hurricane, inclement weather cancels.

Parking info and directions: ($15)

http://www.steamshipauthority.com/ssa/ParkDirections.cfm?Loc=WH

**Carpooling might be ideal, please share gas and parking expenses if you opt to do this.

Passenger tickets can be purchased at all Steamship Authority terminals, Peter Pan/Bonanza Terminals & Plymouth and Brockton Bus Lines Terminals. Passengers never need a reservation but we recommend arriving thirty minutes prior to sailing time, as they sometimes reach vessel passenger capacity on busy weekends and holidays.

**IMPORTANT---some of this ride on MV is with traffic on the street so if your "skiddish" around cars and biking on the street this might not be appropriate. If you park in Palmer Parking Lot ($15) then be prepared to ride some of the Shining Sea Bikeway to Woods Hole ferry** Last time some of us parked at the Catamut Parking lot ($15), if a bike can not go on the bus rack then you will probably have to bike to Woods Hole via 28A. 

https://www.steamshipauthority.com/visitors/parking

GPS: use 286 Palmer Ave Falmouth for the parking lot if you are using that one. Get to the parking lots before 8:30 because even though there are buses they may not come so frequent so you may have to ride the path and that will take some time. When you get to your parking lots just move on ahead to the ferry, we will meet in line there. Ferry ride to the island is 45 minutes.
results.name: Martha's Vineyard Bike Ride 2015

results.description:
Instructor:  Eric Ma


In this tutorial, I will show you how you can use data to construct networks for data analysis. The goal is to demystify graph analytics and mining, and make it accessible to the general programmer. We will go through:

- graph basics (nodes + edges, list and matrix representations)
- modelling problems as graphs,
- preprocessing data using Pandas,importing data using NetworkX,
- how to compute basic statistics of the network
- generating visualizations using matplotlib,
- finding hubs, paths and clusters in the data,

IPython notebooks and data files will be distributed beforehand on Github to facilitate code distribution.

Prerequisite Software:
1. Anaconda distribution of Python installed, with Python 3.4, NetworkX, pandas and matplotlib, and Jupyter notebook installed. Python 2.7 users join the tutorial at their own risk.

Anaconda installation instructions are shown at this Github repository (page down for instructions: http://github.com/ericmjl/network-analysis-made-simple/

Prerequisite Python:
At least some prior exposure and use is strongly recommended: For example being able to decipher a data structure for the variables ’s’ and ‘my_fav_things', given the following line of code:

[s for s in my_fav_things if s[‘name’] == ‘raindrops on roses’]
results.name: PyData Intermediate Workshop on Network Analysis

results.description:
It’s an exciting time to be a data scientist that cares about social impact. 

You won't want to miss out on this unique opportunity to learn about the most current applications as well as tools & techniques to integrate data science and social impact.

This year’s Boston Data-Con will feature organizations that have “Data Science for Social Good” as a part of their mission or operations.  

Program Highlights -The program includes Tech Talks and a separate “Data Science” Workshop Track.

2015 Tech Talks
 These Tech Talks were organized by “Social Good” themes such as education and healthcare.   
   ~Non-Tech: Overview of Data Science-Based Initiatives   
  ~ Initiatives taking place at universities, government, non-profits, corporations, and communities—and how you can get involved
   ~Learning Data Science - a Project Based Approach to teaching data science and executing exploratory data projects;  reflect on lessons from our first two years. 

4 workshops:
2 each for Python and R. Beginner and intermediate workshops for each.   Python - an intermediate Network Analysis  R an Intermediate DataViz 

Event Prices are at Meetup Community levels:
  “Data Science for Social Good” Presentations at $10 per day (or $5 per half-day)
   “Data Science” Workshops at $7.


Please note that presentations will be on 10th floor; and workshops will be running in parallel on the 1st floor.
If you wish to attend parts of both, then separate registrations for each are needed (check-ins will be occurring on each floor).
 For a detailed schedule of talks, please see the presentations page.

results.description:
We practice L'Arte D'Armizare (The Art of Bearing Arms), a historical European martial art. Our main sources of interpretation are the books (circa[masked]) of Fiore dei Liberi, a fencing master from Friuli (thus the non-standard Italian spellings!).

Our students work on a combination of longsword, abrazzare (grappling), daga (dagger/knife) and other weapon skills. These skills are drawn from direct translation from historical sources, developed through multiple physical interpretations and tested at speed. Though we emphasize historical technique, our training sessions are a blend of warmup, interpretation, drill, and for men and women who've passed our safety standards, both focused and open sparring.

New students should take our beginners' class first, or contact our instructors for more information.  We're happy to have visiting scholars from other programs come and play!

See you there!

If there's no parking in Thorndike lot, look for parking on the side streets.

results.description:
This is a 4 week course. If you RSVP for this date you are RSVPing for the complete 4 week course (Saturdays beginning August 8 through August 22). Please only RSVP if you are committed to attending to the whole series.


This course introduces students to the basic principles of 3D modeling, such as how to navigate in 3D space, what 3D models are made out of, and how to create simple forms and objects. The software used will be Sketchup, a free program that is excellent for beginners and professionals alike. Students will learn the ins and outs of the program, from basic techniques to advanced modeling concepts. This series is for people who have not already taken a 3D modeling class at HATCH.


Requirements:


• A free copy of Sketchup. 

• A CAD-capable laptop or desktop. The computer must have a discrete graphics chip or a very new (last three years) onboard graphics chip.


• A three button (minimum) mouse.


• You must be an experienced Windows or Mac user.


• You should be able to utilize keyboard shortcuts and understand how to use computer file systems.


*If you need a laptop please contact the organizer, we have a limited number of laptops available for use. We prefer that you use your own for this class.*
results.how_to_find_us: We're located in the Arsenal Project (formerly Arsenal Mall). Park in the lot near Old Navy entrance, you'll see a big yellow-green sign over the doors. HATCH is between Pearle Vision and Game Stop.

UPDATE (7/17/2015): This event is officially ON and set for August 8 at 11 a.m. at Cassidy Playground in Cleveland Circle (the same spot where we played the Steelers group in football last year)! We'll look forward to seeing everyone come out in purple and black for what should be a great time! If anyone has bases/bats etc that they could contribute that would be extremely helpful!


After the game(s) we'll head over to CitySide, the Boston home of the Steelers, for drinks! .‪#‎BackersWithBats‬ ‪#‎TeamBmore‬

Hey all,
Our softball game(s) looks to be Saturday June 13th at Moakley Field in South Boston. Still waiting for official confirmation from the park about the field reservation, but they said it shouldn't be a problem. Games will take place between noon and 6 pm. Specific game times will be figured out later. Ravens, Packers, Dolphins and Steelers fan groups attending... possibly more to come.

There will be an after-party with all teams at The Banshee, the Packers bar, which I am told is a short walk away from the fields. Ray, the Packers organizer and bar manager, is trying to put together some drink specials but no promises he says. If you rsvp and can't make it, it's ok. This is all in good fun like everything we do here. All ages. All skill levels. After party may be age restricted though...not sure yet. If interested, RSVP here so others can see, then email me at [masked] to get on the group email. More details to follow. Looking forward to seeing you guys!

As some of you may already know, we have been invited to participate in a softball tournament here in Boston, comprised of many of the different pro-football fan groups.  This is the first year, but we hope to have a tradition built and we'll see where it can go.  For now, we are just hoping to have as many of the Miami Dolphans represented as possible.  Obviously, we would love to have you play, but if softball isn't really your thing, please come out to cheer us on!  I think we have one of the largest fan bases in the Boston area.  Let's not allow the Baltimore Ravens fans or Pittsburgh Steelers fans to outnumber us!!

results.description:
Some of us are gathering to explore the New Story and The More Beautiful World that is emerging in the giant paradigm shift that is underway right now. We'll be drawing on multiple sources, especially the ideas of Charles Eisenstein expressed in his book, The More Beautiful World our Hearts Know is Possible. We'll be looking at videos and other materials, asking questions and sharing our thoughts and reflections. 

For more information:
http://newstoryhub.com, http://charleseisenstein.net

This time, we will be looking at and talking about "Inescapable Frameworks"  developmental and historical stages of consciousness.  We may also watch "The empathic civilization"  TED talk by Jeremy Rifkin, unless everyone watches it in advance.  Highly recommended:  https://www.ted.com/talks/jeremy_rifkin_on_the_empathic_civilization.

Why not join us?
results.name: The New Story, The More Beautiful World

results.description:
Social In Boston Presents:

BOSTON ROOF DECKS TOUR

The Summer of 2015 is going to be a great one for the members of Social In Boston! One part of what makes it so great is our weekly roof deck tour. Each and every Saturday we'll be visiting a different roof deck for food, drinks, relaxation, and socializing. Please the details carefully every week, as the details are going to change. Some venues have better times to visit than others, and as already stated, each week will be in a different location...

Our Ninth Stop...

When Fioré was a boy, his mother would have him keep an eye on the sauce while she went to work picking tomatoes at the neighboring farm. It was not long before Mrs. Collela would come home to increasingly flavorful and satisfying meals. Fiore's touch elevated family dinners to a new level and soon family and friends would insist that Fiore do the cooking.

At Ristorante Fioré, a lifetime of cooking experience and passion goes into every meal. Fiore can still be found by the stove preparing dishes people crave. If you ask Fiore what keeps him going, the answer is: you. His greatest joy is pleasing the palates of friends, family and the stream of regulars. Fiore's soul satisfying Italian cuisine is inspired by you.

Join us on the roof deck to eat lunch, relax, and savor an experience like no other!

On the menu: Click here for the menu.

GETTING THERE

Ristorante Fioré is at 250 Hanover Street, Boston, 02113.

Click here for directions on Google. The nearest T stop is Haymarket Station on the Green Line.

Parking: There is on street parking if you can find it, otherwise, check this Google map for parking near Ristorante Fioré. Parking is scarce and will be extra difficult that day with the Madonna Della Cava Feast going on.

See you there Socialites!

~Matt
results.how_to_find_us: Look for us on the Roof Deck! : )
results.name: Boston Roof Decks Tour #11: Ristorante Fioré

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

This was the 3rd winner in our poll.  Time is flying.  I can't believe we are already on the 3rd book!  Check out the description below.

http://www.amazon.com/Jesus-Disinherited-Howard-Thurman/dp/0807010294

In this classic theological treatise, the acclaimed theologian and religious leader Howard Thurman [masked]) demonstrates how the gospel may be read as a manual of resistance for the poor and disenfranchised. Jesus is a partner in the pain of the oppressed and the example of His life offers a solution to ending the descent into moral nihilism. Hatred does not empower--it decays. Only through self-love and love of one another can God's justice prevail.


Hailed by Life magazine as one of the great preachers of the twentieth century; a spiritual advisor to Martin Luther King, Jr., Sherwood Eddy, James Farmer, A. J. Musty, and Pauli Murray; the first black dean at a white university; cofounder of the first interracially pastored, intercultural church in the United States; Howard Thurman [masked]) was a man of penetrating foresight and astonishing charisma. His vision of the world was one of a democratic camaraderie born of faith, and in light of today's global community, one of particular importance.
results.name: Lets Read and Discuss: Jesus and the Disinherited by Howard Thurman

results.description:
Greater Boston Humanists invites everyone in the secular community to join us in our annual picnic gathering in Wayland at the home of our President Joe Gerstein and his wife Barbara (410 Hayfield Lane, Wayland MA) Saturday August 8 at 1. 

This FREE event will include Hamburgers (meat or Vegetarian) and hot dogs (including fat-free), and Salmon Burgers will be available. You are invited to bring an appetizer, salad, drink or dessert, if you wish. 

Phone Contact: Voice or Message[masked]
Please register your intention to attend and with how many guests via the above phone. 

Invitees:  Non-Theists of any stripe and sympathizers. Join us in building community among atheists, humanists, skeptics, and curious friends.


After our lunch, Joe Gerstein will speak with an update on  Samuel P. Huntington's "THE CLASH OF CIVILIZATIONS and the Remaking of the World Order". Prof. Huntington first published an article of this title in FOREIGN AFFAIRS in 1995 which created a sensation. He followed with his treatise in 1996. He made many predictions about the state of the world in the 21st Century, completely refuting  Fukuyama's paean to Liberal Democracy which predicted that the fall of Communism would engender 'THE END OF HISTORY.' Many of Huntington's predictions and observations were remarkably, and tragically, prescient. Let's assess his accuracy and whether his formulations are still germane from the perspective of 20 years of hindsight. 


Dessert will celebrate the 75th Birthday of Ellery Schempp (Abington School District v. Schempp), the plaintiff in a seminal suit that interdicted Bible reading in public schools. 


DIRECTIONS to 410 Hayfield Lane, Wayland (space for parking is at the end of the road):  

Several GPS services now contain this address. Some do not, in which case use 138 Rice Road, Wayland, MA 01778, which is at the corner of Rice Rd. and Curling Lane, which leads to Hayfield Lane. 

NOTE: Able-bodied please drop off food and people, and then park in the lot of the Curling Club, adjoining, which is closed for the Summer, leaving the parking spaces close to 410 for elderly and disabled. 

From the West: Turnpike to Natick/Route 30 Exit. Route 30 East for about 2 miles, then Left traffic lights onto Rice Road. About 1 mile, Left on Curling Lane to Hayfield Lane. Continue to 410
From the East: Route 30 West (or Route 30 West/Weston Exit from Route 128/95) Follow Route 30 West for about 6 miles. Just after entering Natick, turn Right on Mainstone Rd. and follow to T intersection. Turn Left. Curling Lane is about 200 yards on Left and leads to Hayfield Lane. Follow to 410.
From North: Route 128/95 to Route 20 West. About 4 miles you will enter Wayland. About 200 Yards further, take Lest fork on Old Conn. Rd., just before Coach Inn Restaurant. Next left after 1/2 mile onto Rice Rd. Then right on Curling Lane at bout 1 mile. Hayfield Lane on left. Look for herd of White Banded Galloway and Devon cattle on hill to right as you come up Rice Rd. 
From Concord, Bedford area: Route 27 or 126 to Route 20 East. At about 1 mile, just past Prime Restaurant, turn Right on Pine Brook Road. This becomes Rice Road. Turn Right on Curling Lane at about 1 mile. Left on Hayfield Lane, follow to 410.

NOTE: The event will be held Saturday, rain or shine! We hope to see you there!

see data-con.org to RSVP.


The workshop has three main parts: R-Studio, Data Management, and Basic Graphics. We will walk through how to use R-Studio for inputting scripts (multiple lines of code), entering code, installing packages and libraries, running a script, looking at data, visualizing output. For "Data Management" we will be inputting data, manipulating ata using Vectors, DataFrames . We will covering some stats along the way, too. We will finish with Graphics including Histograms, Boxplots, and Scatterplots.

results.description:
Note: 

There will be no face to face meetup unless we reach 50 RSVPs by Thursday of the week. You must be enrolled in one of the 10 FREE courses below or similar courses. 

Our past experience is that 20% of the RSVP shows up in the weekend meetings. Considering that, unless we have about 50 RSVPs, we cannot have a face to face meeting. Please use the questions / answers / discussions below for now. While asking questions, please make reference to the name of the course and the related module within the course. 

Cousera offers the following classes towards obtaining highly valuable knowledge/skills in Data Science Specialization. It is sometimes hard to work on the exercises and homework without the help of an expert.  Receiving one-on-one help from an expert can improve the commitment of finishing the program with accelerated learning. With that in mind, we are experimenting with the following service.


An expert (MS or PhD in Statistics) will answer any question free that takes less than 10 minutes to solve. There are nominal fees for one-on-one interactive help.  Please use the following link to request for help, or just email [masked] or call[masked]-8864.

http://www.tutorteddy.com/courses/coursera-course-help.php 

You can get help for the following Data Science Specialization Classes:  (from https://www.coursera.org/specialization/jhudatascience/1?utm_medium=courseDescripTop )

The Data Scientist’s Toolbox

R Programming

Getting and Cleaning Data

Exploratory Data Analysis

Reproducible Research

Statistical Inference

Regression Models

Practical Machine Learning

Developing Data Products

Data Science Capstone

results.description:
Join me for a kayak trip from Lynn Harbor to the Rumney Marsh Reservation where we will travel up the Saugus and Pines Rivers. This is a motor boat launch which kayakers can use but plan to get in and out of the way of any motor boat users. You can carry or wheel your boat down the ramp or drive down but be careful it may be slippery. Hang out near the launch and look for the other kayakers.  Don't hang out in the navigation channel where the ferry comes in.  

Due to potential strong currents, waves and wakes this is a level 2 trip limited to 14+ foot boats with fore and aft sealed compartments for floatation.   

Bring your safety equipment, water, snacks, sunscreen, hat and plan to be there for a while.  We will catch an incoming tide but may have to paddle against the last of the incoming tide on the return trip.  

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO: Hold harmless, and indemnify the organizers and their relations and heirs, and all members and participants of the Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment. As organizers we make no claims regarding any expertise for this outing. This is not a guided tour. In the interest of safety, consuming alcohol before or during any Casual Kayakers event is not allowed. Wearing of Lifejackets (PFD's) is required when paddling with this group. No dogs or other pets are allowed for this trip.
results.name: Kayak Lynn Harbor, Saugus and Pines Rivers

results.description:
Dear Boston Culture Lovers,


Let's enjoy live music at The Lawn on D Porchfest.

The Lawn on D Porchfest will feature Boston-based musicians in one fantastic day of music. Listen to a huge range of music from Motown, gospel, jazz and R&B, to world, folk, rock and roll and country, performed on multiple front porches built right on The Lawn. The day will culminate in a great dance party celebrating Porchfest under The Tent.

The Porchfest event officially starts at 3 pm, however the START TIME for the Meetup group is set for 2 pm at the entrance of the Lawn on D venue located between Summer Street and Claflin Street.  *** After 10 minutes, the plan is to enter the venue as a group.  The plan is to explore the lawn sculptures and games before the Porchfest concerts under the The Tent. 


Just a reminder, this is an actual meet-up event, not an advertisement. Please only reserve "YES" if you are definitely attending and intend to meet members of the group. If you reserve "YES", we will be expecting you.  If you reserve "YES" and then have a change of plans, please update the attendance reservation.  A consistent history of not showing up for events may cause you to be removed from the group.   


Since this event will be a somewhat crowded and roaming , it will be very difficult for latecomers to connect with the group. If you are late, I can not guarantee that you will recognize me or fellow members or we  be able  to recognize you from the crowds.  Once the event starts, I put away my smartphone and concentrate on enjoying the event with fellow group members. 

Please plan ahead and allow a little extra travel time to this event. 

I look forward to enjoying this event with the group.

Joana

Additional Event Information

What is The Lawn on D?


The Lawn on D is a 2.7-acre outdoor event space on D Street at the Boston Convention and Exhibition Center (BCEC).  


A first-of-its-kind outdoor interactive space in Boston, The Lawn on D is an experimental venue that brings together different communities, audiences and area residents for innovative programming and events in the epicenter of Fort Point Channel, the Innovation District and South Boston neighborhoods. 

There is always something to see, do or experience at The Lawn on D. Open daily during designated hours, The Lawn on D provides a colorful collection of public seating and lounge chairs, rotating public art exhibitions, assorted games such as bocce courts and Ping-Pong tables, and free Wi-Fi. The Lawn on D is perfect place to relax, enjoy the South Boston neighborhood and spend time with friends and family.

The Lawn on D offers a vibrant space with freshly planted trees and greenery, paved walkways, picnic tables, local food trucks and a 5,000-square-foot tent with a permanent bar. 


http://lawnond.com/faqs/


T-Access and Parking


Located walking distance from the World Trade Center Station on the Silver Line and the South Station or Broadway stops on the Red Line. There is also a Hubway bike station in front of the BCEC on Summer Street. Depending on BCEC event calendars, BCEC parking may be available during major events at The Lawn on D.

http://lawnond.com/calendar_events/play-day/
results.how_to_find_us: at the entrance on D Street between Summer Street and Claflin Street, adjacent to the Boston Convention Exhibition Center, south of the Westin Boston Waterfront Hotel

results.description:
Paddle boarding is becoming my new thing! 

We will be going out again; but as we learned on August 1 the Gloucester location has few more waves than the Essex location and is a bit of a challenge. The Essex River is a great place to paddle. 

We will rent with www.capeannsup.com. A half day rental is $50 for four hours, but you can purchase 10 hours for $100, and it doesn't expire at the end of the season. Thus, if you fall in love with paddle boarding and want to continue to go, it would be easy to do for less time and less cost. Based on our experience, 2-3 hours is way more than enough. 

*After you RSVP you MUST call Cape Ann SUP and reserve your rental for this day.* 

You can tell them it is the MeetUp group with RENEE. They will ask for your phone number; in the event that they don't let people go out due to weather they offer to call you beforehand. 

We will be meeting at the Essex location at 35 Dodge Street. You will come to a big parking lot and they will have a small set-up near the water. Please try to get there by 2:45 PM. Come early, get your sunscreen on, etc. We are going out later in the day this time around because of the tide. 

Remember, that if you RSVP and don't bother to show up, you will be marked as a NO SHOW. I don't care if you change your mind, even if it's at the last minute, just be polite enough to let me know. There's nothing that I hate more than waiting for people who never come. 

PS I also have set the RSVP's so that people can not add others. This is because in my experience small groups of people will hold up the RSVP list and then not show or cancel at the last minute. If you want others to join they will need to join either North Shore Women's Group or Casual Kayakers first. 

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO: Hold harmless, and indemnify the organizers and their relations and heirs, and all members and participants of the Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment. As organizers we make no claims regarding any expertise for this outing. This is not a guided tour. In the interest of safety, consuming alcohol before or during any Casual Kayakers event is not allowed. Wearing of Lifejackets (PFD's) is required when paddling with this group.

results.description:
TOSOB will be participating on this eventful day with a outdoor Steppers Set at Jamaica Pond.

The Mission of National Chicago Style Steppers Day (source: www.steppers4ever.com)

The primary mission of the NCSSD is to promote the dance, as well as unity among steppers and to honor the dance.

We will promote the dance to the public through established and innovative means by teaching the dance and inviting new people to learn the dance using both established and new and innovative means.

We will promote unity among steppers through working together as one despite any personal differences which may exist between each other.

We will honor the dance by showing due respect to it's history and culture through our efforts to perpetuate the dance and bringing it to as many people as we can by all possible means.

The venue is outdoors, an open deck with a roof, over looking the Pond. Dress appropriately for weather conditions, it will occur rain or shine. The dance floor is stone, comfy shoes are a must. **

** Floor powder allowed. Bring your lawn chairs, snacks/lunch/beverages. No grills.

Our meeting on August 8, 2015 will take place at DrumConnection, Arlington, MA. You do not have to attend this meeting to go on the trip. Many people from Asia, Europe and the Netherlands, and other places that are making plans to come, will not be making the August 8th meeting.

However if you are in New England and want to ask questions and enjoy the company of like-minded people, please come so you can take part in how we will formulate the trip. What are the things that matter to you? What are your questions? Is this the best African experience you can make?

Please RSVP if coming. Also, please do a little research on Famoudou Konaté so you can know. You can do that here at http://www.famoudou.com

http://www.meetup.com/AfricaTravel/about

Trip to The Gambia, Africa

For all those interested in learning about our Trip to The Gambia on January 9, 2016 with Famoudou Konaté, Fode Konaté, Sire Diallo Konate and many more... we welcome you.

We don't have a lot of time to decide if you want to go. We need your deposit and then we will get a letter of invitation from my brother-in-law for our Gambia Trip! You will send off your passport, get a yellow-fever vaccination, anti-malaria pills and pack. Then, an airline ticket which I can arrange for you or you may do yourself.

Please let me know if you think you are coming to study with Famoudou and me in The Gambia and or Guinea depending on the health situation there.

In rhythm spirit, Alan Tauber, Director

http://www.triptoafrica.org

results.description:
A photographer is an acrobat treading the high wire of chance, trying to capture shooting stars.” – Guy Le Querrec


You can discover how to catch the action this summer by choice rather than by chance.   This Saturday  we will focus on catching life in motion.   If you love to photograph  pets, children, sports, people of all ages but get frustrated because they never stay still, this class will help you be in the right place, at the right time, with the right camera setting, to get the shot.

How many times have you seen the perfect shot, but you just missed it? Or perhaps you caught the moment but it is a big blur? Join us Saturday to discover the secrets of taking dynamic, action shots that are in crisp focus and correctly exposed. Oh and have fun while you learn. We always have a great group and I am sure you will enjoy meeting the other photographers. 

Some topics we will cover:

• How to set your camera shutter priority to freeze the action

• How to pan the subject so the background is blurred but the subject is clear

• How to pre focus so when the moment happens, you are ready

How we will work: We will meet at the hatch shell where I will give a brief introduction to this topic and some handouts. We will experiment with the camera settings for the first assignment and then go in search of action along the river. There are dozens of people walking, skating, biking, boating.....  

Anticipate the shot and get in the right spot. Photo by Suzanne Merritt

Photo by action workshop participant Beth Crastnopol using freeze action.

The light that time of day should be beautiful and we will be ready to seize the moment. There will be a third, surprise assignment also designed to build your skill on the spot. More about that during the workshop....

Photo by action workshop participant Bonnie Greenberg using panning technique to blur the background. 

Then after class we will have our usual social time where we will have refreshments and take a look at the photos you all took during the class. You can join or not as your schedule permits but much can be learned by looking at photos together. You will hear yourself say wow how did you get that shot? And learn from each other on the spot.  After class you will be invited to post some of your best photos of the day on our meetup site for constructive critique. More details about this once you RSVP.


Use the shadows to add visual interest to the scene. Photo by Suzanne Merritt

Tuition for the workshop is $30.00. You are sure to learn how to take better pictures, and meet like minded people when you join us on Saturday. I look forward to seeing you there! This is a non technical group so I will keep the camera settings lingo simple and help you figure it out. All levels welcome. You have joined the group, now join the fun!  Summer is on the move, catch it while you can.


Suzanne Merritt 

Photo by Suzanne Merritt

results.name: Fun New Photography Topic: Catch the Action this Saturday!

results.description:
Have you or your partner ever wanted to be transformed into something or someone else? Find out how in this new presentation from Wiseguy on hypnotic transformations.

Mark Wiseman - better known online as "Wiseguy" is the author of many books and stories. Including "Mind Play" - A Guide to Erotic Hypnosis and the recently published "The Mind Play Study Guide".

The event starts with a presentation on the basics of how to do safe, fun hypnotic transformations. Wiseguy covers a variety of things to consider including defining the behaviors, features and limits of the new form, keeping control of the environment while playing, and transforming your partner back into their original form when the scene is done. Then, members of the audience will have a chance to volunteer to be transformed into a robot, bimbo/dumb jock, vampire, animal, or whatever their imagination conjures up and play a negotiated scene.

There will be time at the end for open discussion, and to pick up signed copies of Wiseguy's new book, The Mind Play Study Guide.

Schedule:

6:00 Welcome

6:15 - Basics of Hypnosis - An intro and review

7:00 - Social - Meet people and munch a bit.

7:30 - "More than Meets the Eye" with Wiseguy

9:00 - Practice, social and purchase Wiseguy's books if you want to.

Additional info and to purchase tickets  go to: https://nelaonline.org/tickets/index.php?main_page=product_info&cPath=8&products_id=23

Prices:

$20 - Earlybird - Online till July 26. - NO LONGER VALID

$25 - Online till day before the event. - NO LONGER VALID

$30 - At the door.

Tickets at the door will be $30

results.description:
This looks interesting.  Although I never was much of a comic book fan, this tells the story of how they get their abilities an learn to deal with them.  

So times have been set and the movie we are going to see is showing at 7.  I will be at the theater by 6 and we will head in for seats at 6:30.  The moive is showing upstairs, so we will gather at the tables, near the big windows, at the top of the escalators.  Tickets are on sale now on Fandango:

Tickets

In general, I arrive at the theater an hour before the show to start gathering people, and we head in for seats about 30 minutes before the show, so we can sit together. This also allows us to take turns getting snacks, etc., before the previews start.  It also allows for any unexpected, last minute changes at the theater.  Although fairly infrequent, having wiggle room to exchange tickets, etc. is VERY helpful.

Please note, everyone is responsible for buying their own tickets.  And while it is possible to buy your ticket at the door, shows often sell out. I strongly advise you to buy your tickets in advance.  I will announce when tickets go on sale on Fandango. Please do NOT buy tickets until I have finalized the time.

If you miss the group ahead of time, come find us after. We gather in the hallway outside of the theater we just saw the movie in, to discuss the film a bit, allow for restroom breaks and to get a head count of all those who would like to go out after for drinks and munchies.

$$$$Managing the after event is much easier if everyone brings cash, so please plan ahead if you want to go out with the group after.  We will be splitting one bill for the group. No separate checks.$$$

One more thing, please keep your rsvp's up to date so I can plan the after event and know who to look for.  Thanks!

"Fantastic Four," a contemporary re-imagining of Marvel's original and longest-running superhero team, centers on four young outsiders who teleport to an alternate and dangerous universe, which alters their physical form in shocking ways. Their lives irrevocably upended, the team must learn to harness their daunting new abilities and work together to save Earth from a former friend turned enemy.

results.description:
You are invited to the Albanian Convention organized by A.A.N.O.  The 69th Annual National Convention will be held in beautiful Boston, MA and hundreds of Albanians from United States and Canada will be attending.

August 7th, 8th & 9th // 2015.

Payment of tickets online is closed. You may purchase tickets for Saturday night at the door. Please call Erin K. at (978)[masked] for reservations. 

$110 - concert and dinner

$70 - just the concert

The Prifti Brothers will be singing on Saturday. Got to love their serenades!  Alba Albanian band is coming from New York on Saturday Night. They are awesome! 

2015 Lifetime Achievement Award:


Mr. Xhoni Athanas - Tenor  


2015 Albanian of the Year Award:

Honorable Superior Court Judge Robert Tochka

2015 Community Service Award:

Dr. Mark Kosmo - Chairman of Massachusetts Albanian American Society "BESA".  

The performance of the Valle Tona Albanian dance group fills you with joy and makes you believe that our heritage lives on.  

Did I mention the dinner? The chef is awesome and the ambiance is priceless. This is a classy event so dress to impress. 

I love the sound of a violin when I am having dinner. Our own, Kristina Danga, will be playing for us some Albanian tunes.

Would you like to be a member of A.A.N.O, volunteer for the national convention or be a corporate sponsor? Please contact Erin K. at (978) 395-7020. Let's make it the most attended and the best AANO convention to date. 

Hotel Reservations

The Westin Copley Place in the Back Bay. This is one of the most beautiful parts of Boston and ladies loves shopping at Copley Mall and Newbury Street.


10 Huntington Ave.
Boston, MA 02116

[masked]
﻿www.WestinCopleyPlace.com﻿

Reservations:
[masked]
[masked]

Mention the A.A.N.O for Special Room Rates

Single/Double - $229 // Deadline July 9th, 2015

Among A.A.N.O's priorities is to support the academic endeavors of Albanian-American college students through annual scholarships. Each year, the organization gives out thousands of dollars in scholarships, and through the years hundreds of students have received assistance through the A.A.N.O.  By coming to the convention or being an event sponsor you are supporting the future of the Albanian community in North America. The scholarships will be given at the convention.

Boston Albanian Student Association is supporting A.A.N.O by selling raffle tickets for $10. The winner will receive two free tickets to travel anywhere in the world with Turkish airlines. To purchase tickets please contact Erin K. at (978)[masked] or [masked]. The proceedings will go towards the Student Scholarship Awards that will be announced at the convention. 

The following is a copy of the flyer with more info about the convention.


Order tickets to the Convention NOW ONLINE or by calling (781) 535-2007.  For more info about the convention please email [masked]. 

Miss. Massachusetts Polikseni Manxhari is honoring us with her presence at the convention. 


Do not forget to run for Miss. A.A.N.O. Every major city where there are Albanian Americans is going to select its own representative.  Also, Toronto Canada will select the representative from Canada. For more info, please contact your nearest A.A.N.O chapter. 

The following is the contact info. NOTE: The A.A.N.O Peagant is not going to take place this upcoming convention (2015) but on the 2016 convention. It is good to plan early.

results.description:
Around the World (Launch Party) - An Anthology of Travel Writing Collected by Harvard Book Store

Selected contributors to Around the World read from their work. 

Saturday, August 8,[masked]pm

Harvard Book Store

1256 Massachusetts Ave., Cambridge

This event is free; no tickets are required.

Summer is a great time to travel, to get away and discover someplace new. It’s hard for a bookstore to get away (all that brick and mortar), but we think reading about travel is a close second to the real thing.This summer, Harvard Book Store is producing Around the World: An Anthology of Travel Writing Collected by Harvard Book Store. It will be a collection of travel writing and art about the places and experiences that have changed you, excited you, inspired you, become a part of who you are. We’ll print the book in-store with our print-on-demand machine, Paige. Learn more about the call for work, and submit to Around the World, here. Join the Party!

The Around the World release party is open to all, and will feature readings by selected contributors to this latest Harvard Book Store anthology, printed right here in the bookstore. We’ll even be printing copies of Around the World during the event for those looking to get a firsthand look at Paige in action!Come sample some travel writing by local writers, sip some refreshments, and learn more about custom book printing at Harvard Book Store.

results.description:
Echoing as much of Raymond Chandler’s novel as it does the author’s life, The Long Goodbye is perhaps Altman’s funniest valentine to Hollywood. While securing screenwriter Leigh Brackett, who co-wrote The Big Sleep (1946), which solidified Humphrey Bogart as Chandler’s hard-boiled 1940s detective, Altman made his Philip Marlowe a vulnerable, droll and mumbling Elliott Gould. From the blithely ingenious soundtrack to the casting of characters partially playing themselves, Altman wryly and improvisationally toys with the mythos of Hollywood as it intersects with the reality of Seventies Los Angeles. The film self-deprecatingly encapsulates the contradictions of the time by mixing the carefree and irreverent with uncomfortable confrontation and sudden violence. Sometimes off-frame or partly obstructed, the camera wanders as ambivalently as Marlowe does around a comic parade of deceptive characters and the elusive truth. The detective’s unpredictable path may encounter all of the essential elements of a classic noir; yet Altman’s translucent lens translates these into the disarming, detailed grain of a faded naturalism underscored by Marlowe’s irresolute refrain, “It’s okay with me.”
[The HFA description.] 

“The film . . is Altman's most entertaining, most richly complex film since M*A*S*H and McCabe and Mrs. Miller. It's so good that I don't know where to begin describing it. . . . There are lots of eloquent references to Chandler in Altman's method, which is to pack the screen with more bizarre visual and aural detail than can be easily taken in at one sitting. There are also references in the appreciation of California decor, luxurious as well as tacky, and in the throwaway lines and uniformly excellent characterizations, including two by actors who will surprise you, Nina van Pallandt and Jim Bouton.”
[review in the New York Times by Vincent Canby, on the film’s release in 1973]


96% Critics’ rating at Rotten Tomatoes


Directed by Robert Altman. With Elliott Gould, Nina van Pallandt, Sterling Hayden
US 1973, 35mm, color, 112 min. Part of HFA’s Altman retrospective.

Note: the film will be proceeded by a 4-minute short by Altman, Speak Low.

Meeting at the film: I will wait upstairs in the lobby until 6:40pm, then will go in and get a seat. You will be able to text me until the start of the film (contact info to be sent a day before the event). We can meet upstairs in the lobby following the screening and go somewhere for a drink and fine discussion before saying a long goodbye for the evening.

results.description:
Join us for a blind tasting of red wines from the Piedmont (aka Piemonte) region of Italy. Piedmont is the second most famous wine region in Italy (after Tuscany). If you are interested in a deeper understanding of Italian wine then learning about Piedmont is a must.  The Piemonte region generally produces three varieties of red grapes: Barbera (the most planted red grape variety in Piedmont), Nebbiolo, and Dolcetto. These three varieties make up the majority of the red wines from Piedmont but there are other more esoteric varieties as well. All in all, the red wines produced from all of these varieties make up 65% of the wine produced in this region. The other 35% is white wine. 

Please bring a bottle of red wine from the Piedmont region in the $25 and up price range and 4 glasses each for tasting. The tasting will be blind so please bring bags to cover the labels. Note that the price point is open ended as many of the wines from this region (ie 100% Nebbiolo) can be a bit pricier. It's likely that we will end up tasting mostly Barbera but I wanted to leave the option to bring a bottle of Barolo or Barbaresco on the table. It's worth mentioning that Barolo and Barbaresco are not the only Nebbiolo wines available. You can find excellent Nebbiolo based wines from all over Piemonte for much less including wines from declassified sites. 

We plan to have some tasty Italian dishes for you to enjoy with your wine. If you would like to bring an Italian antipasto, formaggi, or dolce please do otherwise $10 to help offset costs please.
results.name: A Tasting of Piedmont Reds

During this evening workshop you will learn distinctions and skills to greatly enhance your sensual connections. Within a safe and sacred space you will be guided to open more fully to your own sensations, energy and pleasure.

• Access greater pleasure ~ while giving or receiving

• Reduce performance anxiety and the need to 'get it right'


• Discover how an attitude of curiosity and discovery can open you to new magical experiences


During this special event you will practice:


• Setting Intentions and Honoring Boundaries

• Asking for What You Want


• Harmonizing Practices

• Energy Play

• Principles of Sacred Sensual Touch

• Five Modalities of Touch

• Yin vs Yang Touch

• The Art of Surrender

• Infusing your touch with consciousness, energy and variety

• Cultivating exquisite presence for soulful connection


This non-sexual, clothing-on event is open to all, regardless of experience level, relationship status, gender identity or sexual orientation. Beginners welcome! You may attend alone or with a partner or a friend.

Limited Space. This event is being cross-posted to several MeetUps, so RSVPs on this site do not reflect the actual RSVP count.

Brynn Bishop is an Advanced Certified Tantra Educator and Intimacy Coach with over twenty-five years experience in the field of Conscious Relating. Her mission is to empower people to create authentic, loving, pleasurable relationships with themselves and others. She specializes in catalyzing individuals to reclaim their voice, resolve blocks and develop skills for deeper intimacy, and awaken their sacred erotic potential. Brynn’s unique approach weaves together cutting edge Somatic Psychology and Trauma Resolution with Taoist and Tantric Healing Arts and Awakening practices - providing the most effective methods of healing, transformation and empowerment. She teaches nationally and maintains a private practice in Boston and via phone and Skype. www.conscious-intimacy.com


What participants are saying!

“Great enlightenment and synergy. Safe and nourishing...warm and comforting. Brynn, you are a wonder and I send gratitude to you and all attendees.”

“Thank you for such a wonderful workshop. My soul was deeply nourished. It truly met my needs in a deep way, and I met some wonderful like-minded people.”

“Brynn is a master at making people feel safe. I got a lot out of this workshop.”

“Intensely pleasurable and heart opening."

results.description:
Mijo de la Palma present their unique blend of Puerto Rican music and contemporary acoustic sounds at The Urbano Project in Egleston Square, Jamaica Plain

7pm Cheese & Wine reception (Bring a bottle of wine to share) | 8pm Show start

$10 suggested donation (no one turned away for lack of funds) Born out of the eclectic musical scene in the western side of Puerto Rico, Mijo de la Palma’s sound is an unfolding of handcrafted jíbaro music and modern acoustic rhythms. The earthy, melancholic and intimate lament of the jíbaro intersects with upbeat and catchy tunes of today’s singer-songwriter and flamenco music resulting in their trademark Fusion Jíbara. Fusión Jíbara is not only a creative blend of poetry and musical textures that redefines the sounds of contemporary Puerto Rican music, it also provides the new generations with music intimately linked to a strong Puerto Rican identity in times of severe political turmoil in the island.

Their shows are complemented with poets weaving verses into the musical backdrop and visual artists soaking up the creative energy of the night while painting entrancing visuals on the spot. More than a performance from a musical group, their shows are a creative gathering that speaks to and of a land deeply wounded and regenerating in relation to historical memory. Music, in Mijo de la Palma, is a reassertion of cultural roots; it is never forgetting.
results.name: Mijo de la Palma · Canto'e Jíbaro en Boston

results.description:
The summer fun NEVER ends at Star Dance School--

ESPECIALLY now that we've installed our brand-spanking-new AIR CONDITIONING unit! BRRR!

Beat the Heat with us Saturday August 8th:

Intro Group Lesson begins at 8:00pm (optional, but a wonderful way to break the ice with fellow dancers!)
Party begins at 8:30pm

$5 per person

Join the studio as we continue our Second Saturday Social Series: our once-per-month ballroom dance socials held on the 2nd Saturday. All experience levels and ages welcome, and no partner required! Smart-casual to Elegant attire encouraged.

Check out our FAQ's below for more info and as always...

Happy Dancing!

Peter G and the Star Dance Team

Star Dance School
323 Washington Street
Brighton, MA
[masked]
[masked]

StarDanceSchool.com

----------------------------------------------------------------
Ballroom Dance Social FAQ's:

What is a “Ballroom Social”?
A ballroom social is a dance party featuring ballroom dance styles. Music is played for Standard and Smooth styles such as waltz, foxtrot, and tango as well as Latin and Rhythm styles including salsa, rumba, cha-cha, and the like. At Star Dance School Socials an optional 30 minute group dance lesson kicks off the evening as well!

What on earth should I wear?!
Smart-casual to elegant attire is encouraged, but most importantly wear clothing you can move around in comfortably. If you do not have ballroom shoes often a light weight dress shoe will do the trick. *Note: Please avoid sneakers or metal spike-heel shoes as they can damage our floor. Thank you for your understanding!*

Do I need a partner?
Partners are welcome, but not required to enjoy a night out on the town with us! Social dancing is a fantastic way to make new friends and we encourage dancers to rotate partners and meet new people.

Do I need prior dance experience?
Whether it is your first time dancing or you have years of ballroom under your belt, all levels are welcome to attend our socials!

results.description:
We have a permit to visit the Truro lighthouse, which is the darkest part of Massachusetts and a very interesting lighthouse, too. It is part of the National Seashore. 

This is a mostly moon-less night, the moon won't come up until 1:20 a.m. and if we have clear skies, this will be a great opportunity to shoot Milky Way arches and star point images, perhaps with short exposure skies and long exposure foregrounds. And, of course, star trails are great, too. We might even see one or the other meteor, as the Perseids meteor shower starts around this time (and peaks on the 12th). And if you stay up late enough, you can shoot a 24% moon coming up in the east and if you want to get the most out of your drive, stay up to catch the sunrise at 5:50, have breakfast in Provincetown. If it is partly cloudy, we will still be meeting, the meetup will only be cancelled in overcast and rainy weather.


The sun will set shortly before 8, we will meet half-way through civil twilight, with a little light left in the sky. Please bring at home DIM, RED lights if you absolutely need to use any, headlamps are not allowed! I encourage you to learn handling your camera without lights (practice in a dark room at home: I know that on my camera, the 2nd button from the bottom is ISO, 2nd from top is WB, front wheel is shutter speed, back wheel is aperture, live view is bottom right, that's 99% of what I need). Human eyes need about half an hour to recover from being blinded, please be considerate of the other photographers and their exposures.


This is a very dark site, please be safe and wear rugged shoes/hiking boots, bring some materials for nourishment and perhaps a jacket, it will be a long night, the drive to Truro is easily 2 hours from anywhere.  We will be very close to the parking lot, you can fetch more supplies from there or crash in the car for some time.


Equipment: consider bringing two cameras and tripods, one to click away, the other for targeted exposures. Wide to super wide lenses are best, you won't zoom in to anywhere.


Here are two images from Flickr, Betty Wiley:

and Jessica Kirste:
results.name: Cape Cod lighthouses III: Truro Highland Light

August Annual White Party at Second Saturday 
with DJ LeahV aka 'The People's DJ'. Her signature open format mixing and seamless genre-blending sets have won her the Boston Music Awards "DJ Artist of the Year," Improper Bostonian’s “Boston's Best DJ" and a feature at the 2015 Dinah Shore Weekend.

Why a? What’s a? White Party: the concept of the White Party was created in 1985 as a party to raise funds for HIV/AIDS in a non-political and non-combative way. From the beginning, the committee wanted the party to symbolize community solidarity. White was chosen for this reason as well as for its purity and elegance. results.description:
Instructor:  Vik Paruchuri


Learn how to make inferences and predictions using analytics data. We'll start by exploring a dataset that contains anonymized information about learners on dataquest.io. We'll learn how to read in the data and make some basic inferences and visualizations. Then, we'll move on to making predictions on the data using logistic regression. At the end of this workshop, you'll have the skills to be able to do a small data analytics project from start to finish. Some familiarity with python will be helpful for this workshop -- try the learning python lessons on www.dataquest.io if you want to prepare.
results.name: Python "Data Science" Beginner Workshop

venue.name: Assabet River National Wildlife Refuge visitor center

results.description:
Come explore a beaver pond in the Assabet River National Wildlife Refuge and see a beaver lodge. The beavers are most active at dawn and dusk. Many other animals such as herons, turtles, geese and frogs tend be out as well; enjoy a 1-mile walk  as we look for signs that beavers have been around. Appropriate for most strollers.


All ages welcome, but younger children not able to walk alongside an adult without tiring will prefer a stroller or carrier. Cancels for rain or thunder. Bug spray, sun protection and water recommended.

We will meet in front of the visitor's center, which is inside the refuge.  From the entrance at 680 Hudson Road, turn into the park and continue about .5 mile down Winterberry Way to the visitor's center.


Program led by an AMC leader.  More info on Outdoors Rx.
results.name: Life of a beaver walk in Sudbury

results.description:
Boston VR Devs is a monthly all-day event for developing VR: we'll get together, share project updates, give feedback, hash out development issues, and spend the day collaborating on our in-progress or brand-new VR projects. Anybody ready to write code, craft environments, explore VR art, hack on hardware, or otherwise build VR, is invited to come!


The British Consulate-General has generously offered to host our first meetup, and plan to Skype in some developers from the UK VR scene. Many thanks to Sean Kagan and the Consulate!

The schedule as it stands is:

-9:30: Doors open; drink coffee, say hello.
-10:15: Opening words from Sean Kagan (Consulate)
-10:20: Skype Session with the UK
-11:00: Round-the-room introductions and project updates
-11:30: Unstructured collaboration time
-7:15: Round-the-room recap and discussion
-8:00: To the bar!
results.name: Boston VR Devs August Hackathon

For those who would like to paint a male model for four weeks (it's generally been females during the year), this session will run the four Sundays in August.  We'll need five paying members to run it, so please don't hesitate- you'll have the studio to yourselves and do a long- term complex set up that won't be disturbed.  Our member Lai-Hew will lead the sessions.  

$60 members, $70 non-members (members are those who, by virtue of their unyielding support of the BFAC, have paid their membership during our quiet August)

If you haven't paid the membership, feel free to email to me at [masked], or through meetup rather then pay the membership to RSVP to meetup.   I need to know you're coming so we know we've got enough to run the sessions.  

PLEASE TRY TO BE ON TIME-  folks who come later than 10:00 am will be admitted ONLY at the convenience of the host (who is busy painting).
